details:
Business Analyst - Teller Solutions

Hobbs Madison is growing!  We have immediate opportunities for senior Business Analysts with experience implementing branch banking applications - specifically branch retail teller solutions.  The goal of this initiative is to enhance the customer experience by improving the efficiency & effectiveness at the retail level.  The business analyst will use their knowledge & understanding of front-end, web-based, retail & branch banking applications & systems (customer origination, deposit services, consumer loan origination, new account opening, etc.) at the onset of the project & throughout to gather & prioritize requirements, write user stories & develop the most effective use cases & test cases. 

Performance Objectives for the Business Analyst will include:

Work closely with users & stakeholders at the branch level to gather requirements, develop user stories / storyboards, use cases & test cases with a focus on improving the customer experience
Prioritize requirements as necessary
Improve process workflows
Maintain strong partnerships with IT & business units



Extensive experience working as a business analyst with a focus on retail, branch banking & teller solutions
Hands-on business analysis experience in the implementation of a branch banking platform (TouchPoint, Argo, S1, Harland, D&H or similar)
Applicable knowledge & understanding of front-end, web-based, retail & branch banking applications & systems (customer origination, deposit services, loan origination, new account opening or similar)
Excellent communication & presentation skills - written & verbal.  Able to appropriately interact with users & personnel in all phases
This position will require some travel as necessary.
industry: Banking - Financial Services, Consulting, Computer Software

details:
Workday Payroll Business Analyst
Atlanta, GA
6 Months
$70-$90/hour

Our industry leading client is currently seeking a Workday Payroll Business Analyst to support a large-scale Workday Payroll initiative. In this role you will serve as a liaison between Workday technical teams and multiple business units to provide implementation and production support of Workday Payroll. You will gather requirements, create use cases, and conduct JAD sessions.

You will be supporting all HR systems throughout the organization by working with Workday Payroll. You will be supporting the reporting and querying of HR and Payroll related tools.

The main component of this role is understanding how the business utilizes Workday Payroll to provide best practices for payroll guidance as well as how the technology team can best configure Workday Payroll to the needs of the business teams.

 
For immediate consideration please send your resume to: [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]
 
Keywords: Workday, Workday Payroll, Workday Payroll Business Analyst, 

Skills:

Experience supporting Workday Payroll
Experience gathering requirements and creating use cases
Experience serving as a liaison between technical and business teams

Optomi, in partnership with the world leader in consumer transaction technologies seeking a Sr. Business Analyst for their Richmond, VA location. The right candidate would be responsible for performing the role of a Sr. Business Analyst in a SCRUM based software development organization. The right Business Analyst will have client-facing experience gathering, understanding and documenting requirements. This Business Analyst will enjoy working with a company recognized by Forbes as One of America's Best Employers for 2017!

What the right candidate will enjoy:

The opportunity to work on highly visible projects within a multi-billion dollar company!
Highly competitive pay and growth opportunities!

Perform the role of a business analyst and a product owner in a SCRUM based software development organization

details:
What You Will Be Doing
You will be working on retail and omni-channel initiatives for e-commerce, mobile, social media, etc. We are looking for someone to partner with IT leadership and business stakeholders to gather requirements, translate and document business needs and enhance/develop effective business processes. You will be coordinating with cross functional teams and third party vendors to deliver strategic information technology initiatives to support a new customer rewards program.


What You Need for this Position
Experience and knowledge of:

Process Redesign / Re-engineering - analyzing global business activities/processes.
Applying a structured business architecture approach and methodology for capturing key views of the business and translating to applicable requirements for technology delivery.
Facilitating analysis of viable solutions to highly complex business problems.
Considering business needs across the enterprise and proactively defining strategy for aligning the business roadmap with the IT roadmap.
Analyzing structural relationships of the global business to identify opportunities for improvements.
Working with Marketing and CRM departments to coordinate Information Technology. requirements to support website and deployments and promotional campaigns.
Organization of the delivery and maintenance of the loyalty main website, mobile website and the Android and iOS native mobile applications.


What's In It for You


Get in on the ground floor with an exciting new loyalty program
A culture that values its people and talent
A workplace focused on integrity and open communication
Opportunities for idea sharing and creative collaboration


This is the opportunity to do something special, and be a part of a company’s new loyalty program.
Apply now to learn more about this opportunity!

details:
This position will likely exceed the 6 month duration based on performance.   To be responsible for requirements development and management for the assigned components of the Encore product family.   - Prepare product and functional specifications.  - Transfer information in the form of product and/or system requirements from Product Marketing to Engineering.  - Manage requirement change requests in relation to the project plans to ensure agreed deadlines are met.  - Assist in the creation of user and system test plans.  - Maintain a trace matrix to map requirements through each phase of the product development process.  - Engage with the engineering team throughout the development process to ensure that marketing requirements are accurately implemented as features in the product.  - Serve as Product Owner to one or more Scrum agile development teams.   The successful candidate will learn the features of the product family, what users of the product want to accomplish and what features they value, and the important aspects of the systems, applications, and devices that interact with the assigned areas of the Encore product family, and how those interactions work. Establish and maintain professional relationships in other business units such as Sleep Therapy, Home Ventilation, Patient Interface, and other relevant groups.   Your team  This position will be part of a software product group that develops the Encore family of computer applications, which are used by clinicians and therapists to analyze and evaluate that data that is collected by mechanical ventilators and medical devices that treat obstructive sleep apnea (OSA). These software applications are both web based and MS Windows based and are distributed and used by outside customers to manage patients data, to evaluate how the therapy is improving the patient’s quality of life, and to generate reports for doctors, insurance companies, etc. This position will act as a liaison between the software development team and Product Marketing.   We are looking for  Seeking a highly motivated professional with a passion for software applications. The ideal candidate will have at least 4 years of experience on a software development team but not necessarily a programmer.  Bachelors Degree from an accredited university is required. Since a Business Analyst is a mix between Business/Marketing skills and Computer Science/IT skills, one of the following is preferred: 1) A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or software related program along with an MBA, or 2) A Bachelors Degree in Business Administration or Marketing with extensive experience with the process of developing computer software. Applicants with equivalent degrees such as a Bachelors Degree in Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or Quantitative Business Analysis will also be considered. Agile and Scrum experience strongly preferred.   The candidate will be required to demonstrate proficiency in:  - Writing requirements specifications for computer applications that are unambiguous, testable, and verifiable.  - Interacting directly with end users (clinicians, homecare health providers, etc.), Software Engineers, Project Managers, and Marketing Managers.  - Software application development and/or the process of developing software.  - Distinguishing between customer requests and needs.  - Creating use cases, user stories, acceptance criteria, and other forms of requirements documentation  - Tracing product requirements through the design, implementation, and test phases of development

Establish and maintain professional relationships in other business units such as Sleep Therapy, Home Ventilation, Patient Interface, and other relevant groups.   Your team  This position will be part of a software product group that develops the Encore family of computer applications, which are used by clinicians and therapists to analyze and evaluate that data that is collected by mechanical ventilators and medical devices that treat obstructive sleep apnea (OSA). These software applications are both web based and MS Windows based and are distributed and used by outside customers to manage patients data, to evaluate how the therapy is improving the patient’s quality of life, and to generate reports for doctors, insurance companies, etc. This position will act as a liaison between the software development team and Product Marketing.   We are looking for  Seeking a highly motivated professional with a passion for software applications. Applicants with equivalent degrees such as a Bachelors Degree in Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or Quantitative Business Analysis will also be considered. details:
Business Analyst -  This is a W2 contract position, please consider when applying.
Responsibilities
Gathering BRD's. Acts as a liaison between client area and technical organization by planning, conducting, and directing the analysis of highly complex business problems to be solved with automated systems. Provides technical assistance in identifying, evaluating, and developing systems and procedures that are cost effective and meet business requirements. Works with user groups to provide training, resolve questions, assess user needs, and recommend changes. Prepares specifications for system changes. Recommends and initiates systems testing. Acts as an internal consultant within technology and business groups by using quality tools and process definition/improvement to re-engineer technical processes for greater efficiencies
Candidates for this position are expected to be able to perform the following:

Works with Microsoft Office Suite
Takes initiative and responds to requests

Business Analyst (Black Belt)  
Optomi, in partnership with a Global Investment company in the Baltimore, MD area supporting over 800 billion dollars in assets is seeking, a Business Analyst that will put an emphasis on requirements gathering and bridging communications between the financial services and technology groups. 



The Business Analyst will be responsible for communicating with key system users and the other teams to translate business needs into project requirements. They will need a solid understanding of end-to-end business process, ability to learn financial services if they don’t have the experience, and utilize project tools so they can track the progress. 
 

What The Right Professional Will Enjoy! 

Be a part of an organization that is implementing Agile methodologies and SAFe implementations.
Fast growing company with the opportunity to pave your career path within the organization.
Have the opportunity to build out your own Lean Six Sigma process and work with budgets from 5-50 million dollars.
Have the opportunity to work with other top fortune 100 companies and a large integration between two companies.

 

Apply today if your background includes: 

5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or Project Manager.
5+ years of experience interpreting customer and internal business needs and translate them into requirements.
3 years of experience implementing Six Sigma Black Belt methodologies.

 

Responsibilities: 

Strong analytical and management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into the application and operational requirements.
Intermediate level of proficiency with Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Functional knowledge of internal operating systems and the SDLC.
Communicate with key system users and the IT development team to translate business needs into project requirements documentation.
Use a solid understanding of end-to-end business processes, existing business applications, and business intelligence tools to evaluate how new project requirements impact those processes and ensure integrity throughout the entire process.

details:

This is a contract to hire opportunity with one of the larges employers in the Tampa area.Business Analyst, Technology - Billing and Accounting Systems (ORMB or CC&B)Acts as a partner with the business to facilitate and implement technology solutions. Responsible for writing system requirements that will ensure the technology solution will meet the needs of the business. Leverages appropriate technical resources. Requires a high level understanding of systems, industry and end-user requirements. Applies specialized domain knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. Makes judgements and recommendations based on analysis and knowledge. Creates detailed business requirements for functional (e.g., business processes, rules) and non-functional (e.g., data, security) capabilities. Will act as a liaison between the business users and technologists possessing a good understanding of both business requirements and of technology and are able to explain the business needs to the technologist and can “translate” technological terms and concepts to the business users/clients. Will be part of the workflow business requirements gathering, writing, reviewing and finalizing functional requirement with all stakeholders and participate in solution design. Work with the development team in helping them understand requirements, create test plans, analyze QA and UAT defects, tracks and manages and fully documents changes for functional and business specifications Validates test cases to ensure that scripts will evaluate the business function being performed. Gathers and interprets information from multiple sources (including databases, interviews, etc.) and makes recommendations. Provides support for application development teams including documenting business processes. Translates technical concepts to business audience and business information to a technical audience. Participates in developing estimates and implementation plans for technical solutions. Partners with team members to develop project schedules, reports and documentation. May be required to act as project lead on small to medium projects and/or provide direction to others on the team. Works with User Experience / Design resources to help visualize requirements into prototype. Understands and applies principles in risk management, issue tracking and change management. Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Financial Services experience highly preferred.Knowledge/Experience in the following: Experience in Billing and pricing, understand the Accounting and General Ledger concepts, Revenue Management. Experience with billing applications such as Oracle Revenue Management & Billing (ORMB) or Oracle’s Customer Care & Billing (CC&B) is highly preferred. Proven experience in System Configurations, Conversions, Fit/Gap analysis, documenting functional specifications are required. Has excellent writing, oral and organizational skills. Experience in using tools like TFS, PL/SQL developer etc., have some experience in writing PL/SQL queries. May occasionally work a non-standard shift including nights and/or weekends and/or have on-call responsibilities. May work in a team environment or project room to facilitate collaboration. Knowledge of risk management, issue tracking, change management and requirements gathering.

title: Business Analyst

details:
The IT Business Analyst is responsible for converting business requirements into technical solutions. To be effective in this role, the Business Analyst will need to be able to quickly understand business issues and data challenges within the organization. This role will be instrumental in testing efforts, systems integration, project management, communication, and reporting. This position will report primarily to the Global IT Director.

Job Responsibilities:

Act as liaison between business users, vendors and the IT team.
Develop business requirements as a result of client engagements and business issues.
Provide software usage expertise for business process supporting applications.
Recognize and identify potential areas where existing policies and procedures require change, or where new ones need to be developed. 
Review and test systems for conformance to functional and performance requirements. 
Document issues, activities, and solutions employing industry best practices.
Facilitate communications for internal and external users. 
Effectively handle aggressive deadlines and shifting priorities to quickly assess and resolve issues. 
Project management processes. 
Interface with business leaders and IT teams to ensure projects and systems are delivered to end user satisfaction.
Coordinate system testing and coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT). 
Create Dashboard and Reports using Microsoft PowerBI and Excel PowerPivot.
Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reports.
Research and develop statistical learning models for data analysis.


Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or related field
3+ years of experience in IT Business Analyst role or related role
Requirements Gathering
Liaison between business units and IT
SDLC 
Experience with agile development process
Experience with writing SQL scripts (T-SQL preferred)
Exceptional analytical and problem solving abilities
Experience with complete software development life cycle
Strong leadership skills
Experience with creating Dashboards and Reports using an analysis data tool. (PowerBI, Tableau, Tibco, etc).

title: Business Analyst

details:
UPDATED 04/12/18


Our client has been in business for 30+ years and are the largest provider of Fleet Management Systems in North America to Municipal government. Therefore, the person filling this position will have the opportunity to work with the best team of professionals.

 

This is a unique role where you will be working closely with the company’s CEO and key Managers doing business analysis and writing business requirements for what will often be high-profile projects. Knowledge gained in the process of doing the analysis and writing business requirements will provide insight to monitor the progress of some of these high-profile projects on behalf of the CEO. You will also take a leadership role in documenting Company processes. 

Responsibilities: 

 

Technology Research & Analysis: 



You will do research that results in providing management cost analysis and specifications that advise management on purchases

Or it may involve the identification of vendors or consultants related to a Company need. 
Or the analysis may involve interviewing internal staff, Customers, or external consultants to identify and further define the scope of a project. 
You will execute the purchase and do a hand-off for implementing the product or service with key Company Staff
After you are acclimated to the Company, occasionally there will be epic enhancements you will join in the initial business scope meetings with senior managers and SMEs to record business scope (not technical). After a review process of those requirements, you will then:
Hand off the business requirements to our Development Team for them to use to create technical specifications. 
Coordinate with the Company's Copy Editor to place the business requirements into marketing materials.  
And when the enhancement is complete, you will review the in-product help as the representative of the Company’s CEO to confirm it conforms to the initial business scope. 


Documenting Company Processes and Procedures: 


Maintain and improve the Company's written processes and procedures using state of the art digital tools. 
This will place you in a facilitative role where you work with Company Managers to insure each Team's processes are documented properly.   


Projects:  This is a unique role where you will be working closely with the Company’s CEO and key Managers doing business analysis and writing business requirements for what will often be high-profile projects. Knowledge gained in the process of doing the analysis and writing business requirements will provide insight to monitor the progress of some of these high-profile projects on behalf of the CEO. You will also take a leadership role in documenting Company processes. 





Minimum Required Career Experience:

3-years' experience as a business analyst or procurement specialist or project manager or have an MBA and 2-years' experience in one of the above.

Required Technical Skills:


Strong knowledge of business technology trends.
One-year experience using a project management tool such as Microsoft Project.
Experience using Excel to create detailed vendor specs or cost-analysis documents (We request you to bring 2-samples of analysis that you have created in Excel). 
The ability to write detailed information in an organized and concise fashion. 
The ability to type rapidly to record key project scope in design meetings. 


 Required Professional Skills: 



Strong organization skills and attention to detail.
Highly capable of managing multiple projects and priorities.
High personal standards that will enable you to earn the respect of others.
Excellent listening and writing skills that enable you to interview and facilitate understanding with Company SMEs and then write concise business requirements. 
The courage to speak the truth to help others to stay focused on scope/goals and the communication skills to facilitate collective wisdom.


 Other Valuable Knowledge:



Tools that create process maps such as Visio
Microsoft SharePoint
Microsoft TFS or similar tools
Microsoft InfoPath 


 

Salary and bonus will be commensurate with experience. (Direct Hire, Permanent position)

 

Benefits:

Client offers a comprehensive benefits program including health insurance, health savings account (HSA) for qualified health care and/or dependent care expenses, life insurance, long term disability insurance, 401K defined benefit pension plan with company match, 3-weeks' vacation after the first year.  They are 100% owned by an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). After one-year of service you join the ESOP and will be eligible for stock allocation. The value of these benefits is approximately 15 to 20% of your annual compensation. (Salary plus bonus).

  
TO APPLY: please email your up to date resume (in a Word Document or other editable format such as a PDF) to: [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]  and include the job title (Senior Business Analyst & Requirements Writer, L025) on the subject line. If your experience and skills match the job requirements we will contact you to continue the screening/interview process.

Every day, we help job seekers find work and help businesses find qualified employees. Founded in 1983, Express today employs hundreds of thousands of people, with over 800 franchise locations worldwide. Our long-term goal is at the heart of our company's vision, to help as many people as possible find good jobs by helping as many clients as possible find good people. The Virginia Beach Express office has placed over 4,000 qualified candidates with local Virginia Beach area companies. There is never a fee to our applicants.

title: Business Analyst

details:
Lead Business Analyst - POS (Point of Sale)Location: US-NY-New YorkSalary:  120-135K  Responsibilities:The Lead Business Analyst – works with the Director of Business Systems, Project Manager and other IT staff delivering functional business analysis, requirements-gathering and application troubleshooting support services. The Lead Business Analyst is responsible for the development of documentation for existing and proposed business processes and functional specifications, as well as the facilitation of joint application design sessions with users and IT staff. The Lead Business Analyst will participate in custom software development and integration projects by documenting requirements, creating functional specifications, documenting test plans and managing the software deployment process. The Lead Business Analyst is also responsible for troubleshooting moderately to complex system issues and communicating with all application customers who use the system supporting all venues.  Typically, the Lead Business Analyst is assigned to one or more business units of small to medium size and the project assignments are small to medium scale, moderately complex, and/or moderately to highly visible. The Lead Business Analyst will focus on key functional business areas including, point-of-sale, vending, inventory, purchasing, event and property management, ticketing and warehouse receiving


Prepares business and functional requirements for new systems and for updates to existing systems 
Researches and collaborates with other project teams tasked with identifying current and future business needs
Performs business process workflow, analysis and re-engineering.
Leads and applies department's methodologies to assignments
Defines processing logic and translates high-level business requirements into detailed functional design documents
Develops and maintains user documentation and instructions for all systems for which he or she is responsible 
Works throughout the development process to ensure that results conform to defined requirements
Works closely with end users to develop required test data
Performs system testing and unit audits
Verifies test results for accuracy
Demonstrates and shares an understanding of department's technology development and support activities
Coordinates and facilitates cross-application meetings to define business processes and functional requirements 
Documents meeting outcomes through meeting notes and other documents as appropriate
An understanding of project management 
Understands fundamentals of customer's business
Demonstrates the ability to understand customer need and perform sound business analysis work
Demonstrates good communication skills both written and verbal 
Anticipates customer needs and reacts 
Maintains a detailed understanding of assigned business process area(s)
Participates in and contributes positively to work/team environment 
Provides training on new systems and/or processes
Participates in the vendor selection process, including providing support to Request for Proposal development



Qualifications:

7 or more years of experience as a Business Analyst or equivalent experience
5 or more years of full life cycle experience with both custom development and packaged application deployment, including experience working within a formal development methodology
Experience in a retail environment supporting point of sale (software and hardware) and inventory systems is required
Experience in developing, upgrading and supporting consumer facing e-commerce websites is required.
Experience with the software development lifecycle is required, preferably Agile and Waterfall methodologies
Ability to work in a high-pressure environment solving critical issues with business impact
Able to perform multiple tasks and adjust priorities based on workload or direction from management or customer
Strong analytical ability related to functional business processes and application troubleshooting
Experience in business process documentation and re-engineering
Exceptional verbal and written communications skills are required.
Must be highly organized and detail oriented
A Bachelor's degree in Business (or Management), Computer Science, or related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required 
Full understanding of project management processes and steps
Expert level knowledge of Visio and Microsoft Office Suite of products

 Preferred: 


Experience with systems such as Appetize, Eatec, InfoGenesis, Glory, Ticketmaster, and Eatec, and other venue applications is recommended. 
Knowledge of credit card payment gateways such as FreedomPay, Authorize.net, as well mobile wallets and general credit card processing is preferred.
Experience with mobile applications (iOS and Android), SDKs, APIs is preferred. 
Knowledge of PCI- and PA-DSS standards and Sarbanes-Oxley requirements is preferred.
Supervisory experience preferred.

details:
Genesis10 is currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst for a direct hire position, in the Austin, TX area.Senior Business AnalystOur client has an opening for an experienced Senior Business Analyst within Information Technology with a matrix reporting relationship to the different business units. They will act as an intermediary between Governance Services and the technical community, working with IT project teams and business users to collect, clarify, and document business requirements (using appropriate tools and models) from which applications and solutions are developed, implemented and supported. The business analyst is an active thought partner and application visionary who shapes business demand for technology. Responsibilities include: Works with the business units to create and maintain an operating plan to achieve the strategic vision using their operating platforms and software applications.  Partners with business and technologists to elicit, analyze, translate and document business requirements into technical requirements.  Builds and maintains a holistic view of all processes within Governance Services to understand dependencies, redundant processes, cross functional impacts with regards to the use of software, processes, workflow and reporting.  Communicates business priorities to IT in order to drive effective business solutions.  Conducts research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within the organization, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible.  Leads and facilitates requirements and design sessions with user community. Develops use cases to explain/demonstrate business requirements/specifications to IT team, and contributes business partners' perspective during design reviews.  Works with internal and external developers, consultants, and business partners to meet technology project objectives. Creates documentation of business areas' system requirements and working with IT professionals to deliver effective technology solutions. Assists with user testing and training for new technology.  Identifying opportunities for better leveraging technology and improving business processes to support operational performance objectives and deliver better service to members. Evangelize the virtues of IT process management and the User Experience, and foster collaboration.

Skills and Abilities: Experience in identifying, translating and documenting requirements for custom software, technology configurations & implementations. Proven experience with process mapping and documentation, including change control and identifying opportunities for process improvement. Excellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependencies.  Intellectual curiosity and ability to question business units. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills Ability to quickly troubleshoot problem that may arise in work products/applications. Strong understanding of basic system engineering, object-oriented design, information risk, security guidelines and architecture standards.  Experience with software or SaaS implementations of enterprise-level.  Ability to serve as the translator between business area users and technical staff.  Ability to work effectively on large, cross-functional teams. Logical thinker with ability to process and synthesize complex and detailed business information and processes. Ability to work independently, lead and facilitate group work sessions. Passionate/enthusiastic about problem solving and leveraging a variety of tools (including technology) to improve processes and service delivery.  Strong customer service, analytical and research skills required. Must have a passion for championing excellence in customer experience. In depth understanding of various software development methodologies (e.g. Agile, Waterfall). Proficiency in use of Microsoft Office, Visio, Project Server, Team Services, SharePoint. Client is a Microsoft organization and majority of our custom code is .net. Change management experience is a plus.

Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in computer science, computer technology, business, or related field. 7 – 10 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in consulting services, meeting management and/or board services. Business analysis experience in support of custom software solutions and SaaS implementation. CBAP or CBATL certification preferred. Lean, Green Belt experience is preferred.

details:
Healthcare Business Analyst – Hospital System
Albuquerque, NM

Business Analyst Job Summary: 



Use data to tell stories that impact the lives of the patients and members.
Perform data research, analysis, prepare reports to communicate results, and support development of appropriate reporting/analytics solutions.
In addition to standard tools of SQL and Excel, focus on using SAS, Tableau, Business Objects, MedeAnalytics and other advanced platforms to bring our internal customers to a new paradigm of managing through data-driven tools.
Analyze and synthesize related and seemingly unrelated data into an audience appropriate story to support the business initiatives, accreditation, and regulatory compliance.
Act as a data steward and maintain the analytical foundation through business definitions and design of data marts to ensure integrity and reliability of analytics.
Serve as a liaison with internal business units and external entities to support reporting/analytics efforts.
Utilize strong technical skills, unquenchable curiosity, and a desire to engage new tools and help others.




Business Analyst Background:   



Bachelor of Science (B.S.) or Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in Business Administration, Information Systems, Business Statistics and Analysis, or other technical field required; MBA or similar advanced degree strongly preferred.
Additional years of directly relevant experience may be considered in lieu of advanced degrees.
At least 1-6 years’ experience in data compilation, analysis and reporting, and utilizing appropriate tools, including SAS and SQL use. 
Demonstrated skills in leading a team through standard processes or projects.
Must demonstrate strong analytical skills/capabilities, communication skills (verbal and written), project management and presentation skills/capabilities. 
Strong working knowledge and/or experience with Microsoft Office products, relational databases, and other analytical tools.
Prior Business Objects and health care experience preferred.
Excellent written and oral communications is a MUST.
Requires detailed knowledge of business data analysis, utilizing computers, computer tools and/or information systems and procedures for compiling analyzing and reporting data, including interpretation of data.

details:

We are in need of an IT Business Analyst that has experience developing functional design specifications and analyzing business requirements in a large enterprise environment.  This IT Business Analyst will also be responsible for using SQL to gather information to build reports using PowerBI
 
The ideal IT Business Analyst will come from a very strong background using SQL and will have experience building detailed reports using SSRS, Excel or PowerBI.  In addition, this IT Business Analyst position will support corporate initiatives by gathering, analyzing and documenting business requirements, researching and recommending best practices, and delivering end products that meet business objectives on time and on budget. This individual will be responsible for understanding both technical and business concepts of web technologies, and must be able to communicate those concepts to internal users and software developers. 
 
This position can offer strong compensation along Medical, Vision, Dental and a 401k program.  This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship, nor can we work with 3rd party corporation.  

•       5+ years working as an IT Business Analyst 
•       3+ years of experience using SQL
•       Ability to build reports using PowerBI
•       Excellent analytical and problem solving skills. 
•       Experience with SAP is a huge plus 
 
 
For immediate consideration please send your resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

title: Business Analyst

details:
JOB DESCRIPTION
 The Business Analyst will work with business and technology members of an Agile team to define the requirements for a web application redesign in the post-trade processing space. This role involves research, business analysis, user interface design, and design specifications. The BA is a subject matter expert who bridges communication between all representatives on the team, as well as with external stakeholders.   • Actively participates with other members of the Agile delivery team (Product Manager, Technical Product Managers, Information Architects, UX Designers, Mid-Tier Dev, UI Dev, QA Analysts and other BA’s) on the web redesign of a post-trade matching and settlement application  • Works with the team to translate business workflows, data, messaging, and business rules into user interface requirements using both visual (storyboards, wireframes, etc.) and written specifications (defining detailed user flows, functionality and data mapping in messages); determines and produces just-enough documentation for the design being delivered 

Researches, analyzes, and documents user needs and behaviors as required to inform the UI design; applies detailed knowledge of design principles and user needs to ensure that user interfaces are of high quality, usable and intuitive, perform well and are consistent with other product lines • Works cross-functionally to ensure UI design guidelines and best practices are followed and the design and performance can be achieved despite the technical constraints associated with applications requiring interactions around large amounts of data • Conducts design walkthroughs, demos and functionality feedback sessions with internal and external stakeholders • Fosters a culture of dedication, teamwork, problem solving, and continuous improvement • Partners with internal stakeholders such as Integration, the Client-Facing Documentation Team and the Client Support Team on operational readiness activities by sharing subject matter expertise on features and functions and uncovering operational requirements

details:
Our client, a multinational Technology company, is currently seeking an Operations Business Analyst for a 6 month temporary position with the opportunity for an extension.  The position is a virtual role (100% REMOTE). By working for our client, you will be exposed to a large multinational company (listed on NASDAQ) that designs, manufactures and sells networking equipment, work for a firm with over 70,000 employees, a firm with $45 billion dollars in revenue, work in a fast paced corporate environment and be an integral part to the Sales & Project Management team. Duration: 6 months, with possibility of extensionPay: $45.00 - $55.00/HOURMain Duties and Responsibilities: Description:As an Operations Business Analyst, you will partner with key stakeholders --both within and closely coupled with the Security business-- to ensure a lossless translation of our business strategy into execution. You will help the Security business achieve industry-leading profitable growth by running comprehensive Planning-Strategy cycles, supporting strategic initiatives, composing market insights and directly advising business leaders with the broader Security business community. Drive day-to-day operations of Executive Sponsor program, coordinating with the both Account Teams and Security Leadership to provide support for critical pipeline deals. Support production of both Annual and Long Range plans including administration of the overall Planning framework; drive standardized core processes such as SME inputs, meeting coordination, status reporting and interlock coordination. Responsible for monitoring and reporting on these business programs including: progress against success metrics, overall program health, stakeholder satisfaction and your improvement insights. Specific role includes the following activities: 
 Executive Sponsor program: coordinate over 100 pairings of Sales Specialists with appropriate executive sponsor. Ensure productive engagement 
 Coordinate Annual/Long Range planning: drive stakeholder contributions, schedule and coordinate working sessions, clarify/coach around program requirements, consolidate inputs into Plan-of-Record package, weekly status reporting 
 Coordinate the Executive Sponsorship program

 Experience running cross-functional programs 
 Skilled at validating business cases, offering constructive feedback and 1:1 coaching 
 Excellent communication and organization skills: keep stakeholders informed and on schedule 
 Skilled at using collaboration platforms to provide 'self-serve' program information
 Newsletter writing and similar tools to keep stakeholders informed a plus

title: Business Analyst

details:
Position Description: The Business Analyst's role participates in the planning, design, and development of engineering systems critical to core organizational products and functions. This includes interviewing stakeholders and gathering, compiling, and validating user requirements for development teams throughout the software lifecycle (storyboarding). It may also include researching and analyzing data in support of business functions, process knowledge, and systems requirements. The Business Analyst is also responsible for generating and compiling reports based on the findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues. Position Responsibilities:Working with product development/customers to understand product background & requirements. 
Analyzing requirements and generating use cases, activity diagrams along with detailed functional specifications document or User Stories for assigned functionality.
Working with User Experience team to develop and refine prototypes. 
Working with developers to ensure they understand all aspects of the requirements, including assisting with the logical data modeling.
Working with the QA team to ensure corresponding test cases are created and reviewed before development is completed.
Work with the product owners & project managers to assist in Agile development processes, such as verifying user stories' status per iteration, demos to product development, etc.



 Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in technical or other appropriate field from accredited college or technical school
Major in business, computer science or related field
Project management experience
Healthcare IT project experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in healthcare industry
Experience with mobile applications
EMR integration experience is a plus

title: Business Analyst

details:
Liberty Bank for Savings
Business Analyst
 
Liberty Bank for Savings is celebrating 120 years of service to its communities! With five branch offices located on the north side of Chicago, we are currently looking for diligent, analytical, detailed and inquisitive self-starters to make an impact within the Bank. As part of the Accounting Team here at Liberty Bank, the role will entail exposure to and responsibility for accounting and financial related responsibilities, including data interpretation, reporting, trend analysis and ROI calculations. The role will also focus on learning and delving into existing software systems to help determine optimal usage.
 
Key duties and responsibilities:
·         Assists with analyzing raw data from the Bank core system and other bank software for trends, interpretation, and offering better ways to report and utilize such information.  
·         Exposure to key accounting and financial processes, including the preparation of Bank monthly financial statements, various monthly board reports, the monthly ALCO report, etc., to build management’s awareness of the performance of Liberty Bank.
·         Performs analysis and provides accurate reports on Bank’s retail and loan products and services.
·         Partakes in evaluating the effectiveness and ROI of Marketing, Retail, Lending and overall corporate initiatives.
·         Researches and provide reports on historical and forecasted financial data for the organization, including economic trends and asset management.
·         Researches peer financial activities and provide an indication of the competition’s behaviors, statistical benchmarks and expense management.
·         Upon acclimation to the Bank and it accounting and business routines and cycles, an opportunity to delve into the various software solutions utilized will be introduced, so as to uncover capabilities and functions that are not being optimized, or that can be incorporated in a more efficient and impactful manner.
·         Participation in projects and change management initiatives to improve on processes which result in improved accuracy, better compliance, meaningful cost-savings, and improvement in efficiency.

We are seeking candidates who enjoy working with numbers and data, systems and software, have a strong sense of initiative and curiosity to delve in and learn new things, and can effectively present new ideas and offer suggestions for improvement and change!

Education/Experience:
·         Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration.
·         1-3 years prior accounting and finance experience desired.
 
Skills/Abilities we are seeking:
~  Effective analytical and reporting capabilities.

~ Strong math aptitude and ability to think critically.
·         ~Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work both in a team and independently.
·        ~ Ability to work on multiple projects and assignments simultaneously, and managing time and resources to ensure work is completed efficiently and within established timeframes.
·        ~ High level of proficiency in Excel; strong working knowledge of Office and Adobe; ability to learn new software and systems.


Liberty Bank for Savings is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities). Appropriate background checks will be completed.
 
A comprehensive benefits package offered for Full-time positions, including medical, dental and vision coverage, Life/STD/LTD plans, Flexible Spending Account, 401k+Profit Sharing Plan, Pension Plan, paid vacation, sick time and holidays.  For more information on Liberty Bank, visit us online at: http://www.libertybank.com.  To apply for this position, please email your resume and salary requirements to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

title: Business Analyst

details: Description: This position will play a key role in ensuring projects (change initiatives) meet objectives on time and on budget by increasing employee adoption and usage. This person will focus on the people side of change, including changes to business processes, systems and technology, job roles and organization structures (in collaboration with Human Resources). The position will support project teams in writing and owning change management activities into their project plans and sizing the effort for the Change function (project by project) to rightsize Resourcing requirements to deliver Change activities. The primary responsibility will be creating and implementing change management strategies and plans that maximize employee adoption and usage and minimize resistance. This position will work to drive faster adoption, higher ultimate utilization of and proficiency with the changes that impact employees. These improvements will increase benefit realization, value creation, ROI and the achievement of results and outcomes. In addition, we look for this role to help us better market what we do in Information Technology, and Research Technologies, to help inform/educate impacted stakeholders throughout the organization as to the critical role we play.   This person needs to have the ability to work independently (HANDS-ON role) and will have to work through others in the organization to succeed. The person will advise senior leaders in helping them fulfill the role of change sponsor. This person will also help create an IT change agent network with influential stakeholders to help enhance communications and awareness of initiatives throughout the organization.   Roles and responsibilities of the Change Management Analyst include writing and owning/managing plans and all associated deliverables whether emails, articles, presentations, tip sheets, training classes (in person/online/videos), etc:   This position will:  Apply a structured methodology and lead change management activities  Apply a change management process and tools to create a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative.   Support communication efforts  Support the design, development, delivery and management of communications.   Assess the change impact  Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness and identify key stakeholders.   Assess the impact to Service Delivery (support model)  Conduct impact analyses, assess change readiness, identify skills gap, changing roles/headcount requirements.   Support training efforts  Provide input, document requirements and support the design and delivery of training programs.   Additional responsibilities may include:  Complete change management assessments  Identify, analyze and prepare risk mitigation tactics  Identify and manage anticipated resistance  Consult and coach project teams  Create actionable deliverables for the five change management levers: communications plan, sponsor roadmap, coaching plan, training plan, resistance management plan  Support and engage senior leaders  Coach managers and supervisors  Support organizational design and definition of roles and responsibilities  Coordinate efforts with other specialists  Integrate change management activities into project plan  Evaluate and ensure user readiness  Manage stakeholders  Track and report issues  Define and measure success metrics and monitor change progress  Support change management at the organizational level  Manage the change portfolio    Skills and qualifications:  A solid understanding of how people go through a change and the change process  Experience creating new service delivery models  Experience creating new support models  Experience marketing a department and it’s services to an organization to improve perception and value created  Experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and tools  Exceptional communication skills, both written, quality of presentations and verbal  Excellent active listening skills  Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences  Ability to establish and maintain strong relationships  Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal  Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations  Resilient and tenacious with a propensity to persevere  Forward looking with a holistic approach  Organized with a natural inclination for planning strategy and tactics  Problem solving and root cause identification skills  Able to work effectively at all levels in an organization  Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others  Acute business acumen and understanding of organizational issues and challenges  Familiarity with project management approaches, tools and phases of the project lifecycle  Experience with large-scale organizational change efforts  Change management certification or designation desired

Uses aggregate data from multiple sources to assist in creating a complete analysis, improvement and/or recommendation.   Reviews the accuracy of information provided and responds to requests from management.   Analyzes trends in general business conditions.   Identifies opportunities for improvements by and among the various operating companies. Detail oriented

title: Business Analyst

details:
Excellent opportunity for a Lead Business Analyst in Coppell.  This is is a local office that has the feel of a start up and the backing and stability of a Fortune 1000. They also have one of the best benefit plans in the city. You will play a key role in the creation, management, evaluation, and interpretation of business and technical requirements.   This includes but is not limited to evaluation of design specifications and translation of business needs to technical solutions throughout the product life-cycle.   You must be proficient in all things related to gathering requirements, feature tracking, and change management activities across business IT and supplier teams.    
RESPONSIBILITIES

Maintain currency in business analysis practices, procedures, and techniques
Follow up with internal clients about completed tasks to ensure client satisfaction
Identify requirements for testing, develop test plans and script, and coordinate test transmissions as required
Define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access
Elicit requirements using interviews, data analysis, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and workflow analysis 
Decompose high-level business requirements into an appropriate level of business rules and detailed user, functional, and non-functional requirements using alternative views such as flows, diagrams, models, and use cases when applicable
Create Babok training including process, timeline, and standardized templates
Conduct training sessions for Babok
Perform Ad-Hoc reporting and report support as necessary  
Lead the identification and documentation of business metrics  
Work with development and business personnel to develop and execute plans to test and validate systems/applications and business requirements - including developing user documentation, first draft of training materials, manual updates, and field communications 
Manage project documentation deliverables 
Assist in identifying data quality problems and determine remediation steps
Create customized reports based on data provided by various teams via emails, phone calls, meetings and updates within change management system
Act as a liaison between departmental end-users, in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of case management systems to ensure optimal operational performance
Develop requirements for new systems and enhancements to existing systems to ensure the system design fits the needs of the users
Identify opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system driver changes
Read and interpret case management systems and functional technical literature and translate in terms understandable to the end-users
Research and prepare statistical reports using data 
Consolidate information into cohesive and understandable correspondence or other written form for use in management decision-making
Assist in developing an overall change management strategy 
Conduct change impact analysis to assess the potential implications of changes and documents business rules, functions and requirements
Participate in user acceptance testing and testing of new system functionality
Direct or participate in studies of new and existing programs and special projects to determine feasibility, resolve problems including organizational, procedural, technical and fiscal research and analysis


QUALIFICATIONS

8+ years of experience with requirements management or change management systems
8+ years Business Requirements writing experience
1+ years of experience with various software development methodologies
Documentation skills including non-functional, functional, business rules, and business processes are required as well as solid verbal communications
Expert knowledge of the Software Development Life-Cycle (SDLC) and/or Product Development Life-Cycle (PDLC)
Experience or background in business analysis, requirements definition, building systems solutions, and deployment of business requirements
Visual Basic, SQL experience, general programming
Strong knowledge of Visio and MS project
Good organizational skills; able to assemble and present information clearly
Customer service focus
Ability to understand, configure, and manage complex technology solutions
General understanding of Windows, MS Office, Outlook
General understanding of data flows

title: Business Analyst

details:
Our Eastern Operations Center in Parsippany, NJ is currently recruiting for a Technical Business Analyst. As a Technical Business Analyst, you will have responsibility for capturing business data, building business models, and processing solutions to address business needs.In this role, you will gather data, identify structure and context, extrapolate the insights and create reports. Produce financial, market and operational analysis by querying data repositories and generating periodic reports. Devise methods for identifying data patterns and trends in available information sources. Provides reports on financial and performance measures on both a recurring and ad-hoc basis.Functions:
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Developing database solutions to store and retrieve company information
Extract data from databases and data warehouses for reporting and to facilitate sharing between multiple data systems
Assist in the design and development of data warehouses and other database components to support Business Intelligence dashboards and reporting
Provide recurring and ad-hoc reports as required on financial and performance measures;
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Analyzes and interprets financial and operating data for management including performance benchmark reporting, cost analyses, market niche reporting, profitability analyses, performance assessments, contract pricing analyses, wage analyses, and other reporting as required
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Standardize data collection by developing methods for database design and validation reports
Synthesize current business trends or data to support recommendations for action
Analyzes and interprets trends; identifies and communicates loss trends; recommends corrective actions to stem immediate shortfalls while addressing long-term profitability issues.
Oversees and coordinates financial programs for funding new and continued operations in order to increase productivity and maximize profitability
Provide application analysis and data modeling design to collect data for a centralized data warehouse.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Work with team members and functional leads to understand existing data requirements and validation rules to support moving operational data into data warehouse
Other duties as assigned by management
Education/Experience:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field, and a minimum of three years progressively responsible business experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc) and databases (SQL etc)
Programming language (JAVA, Python, Ruby, XML, Java, ETL frameworks, VBA)
Competencies :
Strong understanding of business intelligence tools, databases, systems and methods
Skill in financial and operational analysis
Demonstrated knowledge of ethical business practices
Ability to think strategically, synthesize complex business/financial data and develop solutions
Ability to interact effectively at all levels and across diverse cultures
Ability to be an effective member of complex project teams
Ability to use financial systems and standard office applications software effectively
EOE M/F/Vet/DisabilitiesBenefitsMedical, dental, and vision coverage offered, along with 401k and life insurance.

utilizing formal and informal written communication methods (for example, emails, newsletters, PowerPoint presentations, executive updates, task lists, updates) to communicate updates and findings; and facilitating project meetings and presentations to all types of diverse audiences (for example, senior management, Customers, technical staff) Provides and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilities Provides project level analysis – producing required project analysis documentation (business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, UAT plan) Collaborates closely with developers to implement the requirements, provide necessary guidance to testers during QA process Identifies improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive) Assess business process and system inefficiencies Identifies ways to increase adoption and customer satisfaction Demonstrated fluency in business processes and process differentiation Ability to analyze and synthesize business requirements, including recognizing patterns and conceptualizing processes  Required Skills:  Expertise in healthcare ERM/EHR or PM solutions Knowledge of the area of specialization Analytical and investigation skills Ability to understand the bigger picture Working knowledge of data and business process modeling Elicitation and comprehension skills Understands technical concepts and database concepts like DBMS, ETL and SQL Organizational and presentation skills Interpersonal and managerial skills Functional analysts possess profound knowledge in their areas of expertise and help organizations achieve their business goals by recommending solutions that align with their strategic objectives. title: Business Analyst

details:
As an RPA Business Analyst, you’ll be tasked with creating documentation including requirements, process mapping (using MS Visio), acceptance criteria, user guides, and best practice sharing. You’ll also be responsible for: • Assisting the Product Owner / Subject Matter Expert in leading, directing, and reviewing all activities associated with delivering RPA products • Conducting Design Thinking sessions, gaining insights the process and customer needs • Managing the Product Backlog for a project • Working with the Product Owner to prioritize requirements, define and manage scope for a project • Providing operational support to subject matter experts and other clients, engaging with various teams to resolve problems as they arise • Product quality, project timeliness, and customer satisfaction • Documenting the entire process end-to-end ensuring that exception paths are identified and addressed • Working with the process owner to define and document user acceptance test cases The RPA Team is responsible for the design, development, and deployment of technology, tools, and standard processes to support the delivery of Robotic Process Automations. The team is focused on enhancing competitive advantage through automation, value-added, and efficient automations to our clients. It is dynamic team with professionals of varying backgrounds from technical coding, technology development, change management, Six Sigma, and project management. The team consults and executes on a wide range of initiatives involving process and tool development and implementation including training development, engagement management, tool design, and implementation. 

Basic Qualifications: • Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Business Administration, or relevant educational or professional experience • Experienced Robotics Process Automation (RPA) analyst to help lead UI/UX understanding • Have a strong understanding of the RPA business environment • Lead application discovery to help identify/refine RPA opportunities • Help steward RPA opportunities and help bring experience in RPA best practices • Requires experience in process design and process improvement • Requires Advanced written, verbal analytical and communications skills • Strong interpersonal and relationship skills • Ability to coordinate and work effectively with teammates, end-users and leadership • Ability to work in a virtual team environment • Requires the ability to complete work in an acceptable timeframe, manage a variety of detailed tasks and responsibilities simultaneously. Complete all tasks with accuracy to meet deadlines, goals, objectives and satisfy internal and external customer needs related to the job • Requires a familiarity with agile project methodology Preferred: • Experience working on engagements that have incorporated Robotic Process Automations (RPA)with one of the market leading RPA platforms : UiPath or equivalent • Experience utilizing report writing best practices (optimization, use of joins and sub-queries) • Experience with manual testing to include User Acceptance Testing (UAT) • Experience pulling data from Microsoft SQL Server 2005/2008 R2/2012/2014, Oracle, SAP, text files, excel files, MS Access databases for reports • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Power Point, Visio)

title: Business Analyst

details:
Treasury Business Analyst, who can support key business initiatives with insight derived from data for our Treasury Department. This person will be responsible for automating the generation of various internal reports for use by Treasury operations staff. Reporting to be automated will be for purposes including, but not limited to, daily positioning of domestic and international cash balances, cash forecasts, automation of transaction approval processes, daily reporting and analytics.
The Business Analyst will be required to work with the process owners and other internal teams to:


Develop automated approaches to pulling data from existing sources such as daily bank files, propriety coin inventory systems, data cubes, SQL Server-based BI environments, and the company’s ERP (SAP), Cash Receipts, Payment Register, FX, Banking, Banking Feeds both inbound and outbound (Citibank)), Finance and Controllership,  Auditing (Internal IT, SOX, External – Deloitte).

Automate the calculations on that data and population of results in reports for use by Treasury and other finance staff,
Educate Treasury staff on the automation tools employed for the above purposes so they may sustain the newly-automated environment independently going forward


Key Responsibilities:

Elicit requirements using interviews, business process descriptions, business analysis, task and workflow analysis
Responsible for elevating the efficiency and effectiveness of the processes that exist within Treasury; offering recommendations on how best to construct these processes in order automate many daily tasks
Lead process redesign initiatives; solutions developed & implemented should be innovative, thorough, practical, and sustainable.
Build critical tools and automate processes for efficiency
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
user friendly automated solutions
Utilize your experience in using enterprise-wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies required
Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational solutions.

Education & Experience:

3+ years related experience

Experience with Treasury Functions. Cash Receipts, Payment Register, FX, Banking, Banking Feeds both inbound and outbound (Citibank)), Finance and Controllership,  Auditing (Internal IT, SOX, External – Deloitte).

Experience with relational databases and data modeling
Experience with software development lifecycles, including agile software development
Experience with SQL strongly preferred
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with users, team members and management
Organized and detail-oriented
Proven experience at driving consensus across multiple stakeholders


Strong facilitation skills. Must be able to elicit requirements from various personalities across organizational and geographical boundaries
Experience applying these skills and abilities to finance, accounting, or treasury functions is highly desired.

details:
Kelly IT is looking for a Business Analyst For our client in  Seattle, WALocation: Seattle, WADuration: 6 months could extendWork from home 50%Position SummaryApply knowledge of business and technology to allow for the development of integrated solutions to resolve technical and business issues. Serve as a liaison between internal customers and functional IT departments during the initial phases of development efforts for various business initiatives. Apply structured methodology in the creation of requirements from the business perspective, translated in to easily understood formats that are acted upon by the various technical design and development teams in IT. Following BA principles and accepted methodologies, define the system and functional requirements of technical projects. Define specifications and data models for development efforts and testing. Create detailed test cases and analyze results. May assess available technologies and recommend solutions to technical teams. This position will focus on quality assurance, process steps and output for multiple customer projects, programs and IT systems.ResponsibilitiesWork is typically performed under general supervision, receiving some guidance from manager/supervisor about the work that needs to be completed. May receive guidance on how to complete some assignments. Able to exercise moderate level of discretion and latitude in completing tasks and prioritizing work. Work is typically completed by following established policies and procedures but may require interpretation to meet unique business needs. Work may be reviewed by senior level staff or by management.
 Apply good knowledge of systems to analyze and make recommendations to develop integrated solutions to resolve business issues. Participate and assist Sr. level Team Members in facilitating meetings with customers to understand business needs and identify the best solution
 Using multiple information gathering techniques, assist in conducting facilitated sessions with customers to define detailed business requirements for solution development. Establish and maintain clear scope boundaries for the solution. Assist in the development of clear and concise functional requirements for the technical developers that are free from ambiguity to minimize re-work and errors.
 Develop precise documentation of prioritized functional requirements that can directly be converted to test plans, use cases, and system conceptual designs to meet performance targets and development project plans.
 Assist in translating requirements and use cases to the designers, ensuring there is a clear and concise understanding of requirements. Review test conditions and expected results for product, performance and user acceptance testing.
 Participate in quality management reviews as outlined in the project work plan, and in reviews of the designs, prototypes and other project work products to ensure they fulfill the requirements.
 Performs other related duties and participates in special projects as assigned.

details: Experis is looking for a Sr. Level Business Analyst for a long term contract role in the Tampa, FL area. The ideal candidate must have Agile experience, and experience working in large scrum-based projects. This role is responsible for overseeing Business Analysts or having individual responsibility for applying analytical skills to determine and document accurate business requirements; presenting these requirements in a manner that is concise, measurable and flexible enough to meet project and stakeholder needs. This person should have exceptional verbal and written communication skills. This role liaises with IT, Demand, and Business Stakeholders in order to understand the structure, policies and operations of the business and to recommend solutions that will enable the Business Stakeholders to achieve their goal(s). This role works with the Project Manager and Relationship Manager to manage the stakeholders' expectations, ensures that the solution is within the expressed business need, and provides business analysis work progress and other relevant information that may affect the project scope, schedule and cost. This role also will work closely with the Test Lead. Must have at least 5 years experience in the following areas: Knowledge with the SDLC activities expected to develop custom developed and packaged applications with exposure to Business Process Modeling and/or Re-engineering is preferred. Also Business Use Case Development, Business Rules Development, Use Case Driven Requirement Methods, UML and RUP knowledge is preferred. Candidates should have knowledge in Enterprise Application Portfolio Strategy/Development. Experience in Agile development, Team Foundation Server, including entering User Stories, Bugs, Enhancements, Burndown and working with off shore resources. Experience with stfSoft Strong business analysis skills, facilitation skills and a thorough understanding of analysis deliverables (including UML artifacts and how they relate to the development process). Demonstrated technical and leadership expertise in application development and project management in distributed systems and web technologies. Strong technology acumen and track record of hands-on implementations across multiple technologies. Ability to translate technical data and concepts and communicate them to non-technical personnel. Strong skills in both technology and business domains, creative and practical in managing the relationship between the two. Strong background in implementing enterprise initiatives on a large scale. details:
Agile Business Analyst

 Founded in 1996, based in Denver, CO, Softec Solutions is a leading IT staffing solutions and services company that takes the challenge out of finding high-demand technical skill-sets. Softec takes a proactive approach in understanding business challenges and local market analytics, provides customized recruiting solutions, and delivers value and results.   Softec Solutions is currently seeking an Agile Business Analyst.  This role is responsible for activities involving the formulation of systems scope and objectives, analyzing and evaluating existing or proposed systems, and devising or modifying procedures to solve end user problems. Conducts feasibility studies, time and cost estimates, and investigates the establishment and implementation of new or revised application development teams, business unit teams, business teams, business unit teams and 3rd party vendors for evolving service management.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES 
·       Needs to be proficient in both Agile and IT Service Management framework and process requirements.
·       Excellent communication skills
·       Can work independently and across cross-functional teams within and outside of the program. 
·       Provide support to Workstream Leads and be responsible for providing assigned deliverables.
o    ITIL v3 certified - Foundation  
o   Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and/or Certified Scrum Master (CSM) certified
o   Understands Agile process and management including understanding work from a Value Stream Mapping perspective
o   Jira (required)
o   Ability to translate Agile based Themes and Epics and decompose into detailed requirements written as either user stories and/or jobs to be done (JTBDs) 
o   Clearly identify and articulate the requirement(s) which the engagement will address (problem statement)
o   Define, document and sign off the deliverables and outputs associated with the role
o   Engage with appropriate stakeholders to elicit and validate the requirements and ensure that the proposed solutions meet the objectives 
o   Create and maintain artefacts, including but not limited to functional requirements, current state analysis, stakeholder analysis, data model documentation, test plan, test cases, user acceptance test, and process mapping.
o   Able to work with a team and on tasks without supervision
o   Assist with process improvement initiatives which seek to lean out and resequencing process activities in support of DevOps, Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing, and Continuous Delivery/Deployment practices. 

Softec Solutions, Inc is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer.
PEOPLE. EXPERIENCE. RESULTS.
