title: Business Analyst

details:
Volt is looking for a Business Analyst for our client in the Raleigh, NC area.We are seeking a well-rounded, technical business analyst who will be involved with analyzing and specifying new projects, as well as improving and upgrading existing solutions for the customer. The analyst will draw on a variety of problem solving abilities and technical skills, working closely with the client as well as the internal development team to elicit requirement, gather & analyze data and design a solution to meet the business need presented by the client.Responsibilities   Establish and develop a healthy, constructive working relationship with our clients in the asset management industry. Apply yourself actively across multiple projects that are in various phases of delivery, working with a team and clients that span multiple time zones (from the Americas through EMEA). Analyze client data (in various formats such as CSV, XLSX, XML, JSON etc.) for validity, accuracy and completeness; Perform a gap analysis on the data to identify shortcomings or potential risks. Elicit, gather, analyze and document the client’s business and user requirements through running workshops and meetings with the client; Identify the core business problem to be solved and/or value to be added by client using business analysis tools, techniques and best practices. Applying your knowledge of the client platform and products, design a solution that fits the client’s data model and meets the client’s business & user requirements. Own the business and functional requirements of the client and act as the subject matter expert to ensure synergy between what the client wants/expects and what the implementation teams delivers. Attend ceremonies (stand-ups, grooming, retrospectives) to help manage and groom the delivery backlog and to field questions from the developers or QA team. Own the documentation space, ensuring it is up-to-date, organized neatly in accordance with standards and contains all relevant information. Design user interfaces (website wireframes and components) using industry standard tools and technologies. Ensure the delivered solution accurately meets the client requirements as initially identified – the business problem or value proposition. Provide support to the project manager, where applicable. Continuously improve and add value to the business analyst team and function by open and honest communication with the team, hosting training sessions on pre-decided topics, staying current with BA industry trends and technology and feeding this back into the team. For the right candidates, there is the opportunity to assume a leadership role within the business analyst function.  
Required Skills   Excellent communication (verbal, written and interpersonal) and presentation skills. Excellence in personal organization, time and stress management. Strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities; Proven knowledge of fault-finding methodologies and an approach to root-cause analysis. Self-motivated and highly driven to continuously learn, adapt and improve yourself and your team. A good understanding of databases and data concept. General tools such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) or GoogleDocs. A strong ability to perform requirements elicitation and documentation. The ability to confidently push back on out-of-scope, unreasonable or irrelevant requirements and communicating / justifying your reasoning. The ability to design a website solution using wire-framing tools, showcasing an understanding of web elements, components and modules. An understanding of the software development life cycle and the comparative pros and cons of traditional (“Waterfall”) and Agile techniques.   
Preferred Skills   Experience in web design using Photoshop, Sketch (+ Craft) and InVision. A background in asset management or detailed knowledge of the industry. An understanding of development tools and technologies such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript (specifically node and react). A good understanding of cloud service providers and technologies as well as future trends in this space. Experience in working with database technologies such as SQL Server or MySQL as well as RESTful APIs (XML/JSON). Management and documentation tools such as Jira and Confluence; Diagramming tools such as Visio, Gliffy or yEd; Experience with both Windows and Mackintosh operating systems.  
Qualifications   At a minimum, a diploma / degree or equivalent qualification in Computer Science / Information Systems. Diploma / certificate in Business Analysis preferred. Additionally, a qualification in the Financial Services industry preferred.  
Volt is an equal opportunity Employer

title: Business Analyst

details:
Seeking experienced Business Analysts and Senior Business Analysts for Dallas based Client.  Client is a global company focused on the growing market for document management solutions.  

Responsibilities:

The Business Analyst owns the requirements and the requirements gathering process in support of the Project Manager and the Consulting Team.  The Business Analyst is responsible for gleaning requirements from the customer, documenting them clearly, gaining agreements and signoff from all stakeholders, communicating them to the consulting team and monitors activities for scope creep.  The Business Analyst recommends improvements to the requirements process.



 Main responsibilities: 

 Activities and expectations: 



Gain and use deep understanding of Client’s products, ECM, taxonomy and structured database technology


Interview customers to understand their business needs. Define technical and business requirements that match the customer’s needs and the Statement of Work (SOW)


Identify any requirements requested by the customer that are beyond the SOW


Document requirements in a clear, easy to understand way for both the customers and the consulting team, using defined templates


Be able to build demo's and prototypes for customers using the Client’s product


Work with the consulting team to revise the requirements and design so they can be reasonably implemented within the Client’s products


Communicate any revisions in requirements to the customer and get their buy-in


Communicate the intent of the requirements to foster a clear understanding of the requirements with the customer, the Project Manager and the Consulting Team, gain agreement and signoff


Create and maintain requirements templates and other templates or tools associated with the requirements process


Design and execute test cases, and assist customer with the same


Stay on top of trends in the industry for capturing and maintaining requirements, and recommend improvements to the process



 

 Deliverables: 



Requirements documents, test cases and documentation, and demo's and prototypes if necessary for each project


Requirements traceability matrix for SOW to requirements, requirements to design and requirements to test cases for each project


Signoff document from all stakeholders


Create descriptions of out of scope requirements in support of add-on sales or change control



 

 


 Key competencies: 

 Skills & Experience: 



Degree: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field from accredited US college


Experience: 5-8 years’ experience working in the United States


Minimum 5 years of experience in the software industry, preferably with a SaaS organization


Minimum 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst in an IT consulting organization


Demonstrable experience translating business needs into technical requirements


Enterprise content management experience preferred


Excellent English written and oral communication skills required


Strong presence with customers


Strong time management and personal organization skills to handle multiple concurrent assignments.

title: Business Analyst

details: Business Analyst II  Major Duties and Responsibilities  * Acts on behalf of the business owner or product owner to meet the needs of the Scrum Development Team and assure product delivery * Develops a clear understanding of the customer's needs and defines a Product Backlog * Constantly re-prioritizes the Product Backlog based on customer feedback, market changes and business priority. * Determines the appropriate product Release Date and Content * Actively manage internal and external stakeholders * Accept or reject the product teams work results at each Sprint Review meeting * Maintain a basic knowledge of software development * Provide regular reporting including product spend, scope, schedule and planning * Manages the integration and communications among applications, databases and technology platform teams * Administers company technology practices, standards and procedures * Manages an inventory of technology related assets hardware, software, application systems, databases, licenses, products * Makes decisions based on documented business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications * May manage a portfolio of development projects with implication to cost reduction initiatives * Analyzes a variety of work processes and associated document and information flow for strategic recommendation to leadership * Oversees group that defines and implements new or enhanced applications into a production environment * Manages Third Party relationships with software integratorsSkills and Abilities * Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously * Experience in software Product Development (Products having a graphical user interface is a must. Applications delivered to a mobile phone preferred. Customer facing websites secondary.) * Demonstrable knowledge of software development lifecycles and activities * A strong understanding of software Agile methodologies * A clear ability to manage a range of different personality types in a facilitative and mature manner * Strong relationship building skills including the ability to relate constructively to all levels of the organization * Strong listening and written and oral communication skills * A proven ability to plan, undertake and finish activities to achieve high quality results * The desire to be part of and contribute to a team environment * Demonstrated commitment to keeping sensitive information confidential * Ability to articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical addressees * Exceptionally self-motivated and directed * Very high level of interpersonal skills to work effectively with others, motivates employees, and elicits work output * Knowledge and understanding of Information Technology industry trends, directions and market experience; ability to relate them to own organization * Knowledge of architectural concepts, principles, and tools relevant to infrastructure, information, Applications, organizational structure, etc. * Familiarity with company's information architecture and information management methodologies * Proven experience developing product requirements using an Agile project/software development lifecycle methodology (User Stories preferred) * Extremely high level of sound logic and analytical ability where problems are very unusual and difficult * Highly developed oral and written communication skillsExperience * Likely representation experience of 3+ products * Likely 4+ years of experience * Intermediate regarding skill mastery. The candidate must have the following skillset/attributes: * Experience creating user experience artifacts such as user stories, storyboards and wireframes * Problem solving skills to facilitate a shared understanding of problems, possible solutions, and determine the scope of any required changes * Critical thinking skills for evaluating multiple options and helping a team settle on problem solutions. Ability to listen to stakeholder needs but also critically consider those needs and ask probing questions until the real need or problem is surfaced and understood. * Demonstrate a strong technical aptitude in business and consumer applications. * Demonstrable knowledge of software development lifecycles and activities. * A strong understanding of software Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum * Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously * The candidate must have excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with a diverse group of technical architects, developers and QA/SMEs. * Ability to work in across diverse teams and produce excellent results in a fast paced environment * Ability to articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical addressees. * Jira, HP/ALM experience is beneficial * Ability to articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical addressees * Exceptionally self-motivated and directed. * Work experience in Android/Mobile App development is a plus.  Job Responsibilities include: * Define/Document & Represent User Stories and other artifacts to various development communities throughout development lifecycle * Constantly re-prioritize the Product Backlog based on customer feedback, market changes and business priority * Engage daily with various development communities during the product development lifecycle in order to provide User Story (requirements) clarification and immediate feedback upon completion * Coordinate and facilitate necessary interactions in order to obtain answers, provide direction, or eliminate impediments during product development * Confirm product meets User Story and design intent as part of Scrum Sprint exit criteria * Prepare and maintain artifacts associated with development progress such as backlog burn-up chart * Help to capture information pertaining to development progress and productivity * Help to determine potential release content and release date * Help monitor and determine the product market impact in order to help determine future product direction * Coordinate corrective action in response to negative product market impact due to product defects * Help facilitate Scrum events such as backlog refinement, daily stand-up, sprint review, and sprint retrospective. * Experience in bringing closure of action items and ability to follow-up on different artifacts with multiple teams in the organization.  Education: * Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering or related is Required. * Master's in Computer Science, Engineering or related is a plus. About VisionIT: VisionIT is where integration and innovation intersect. We are a global software development company and a preferred systems integrator, operating throughout the U.S., Canada, and Latin America. Our 20 years of experience supporting Fortune 500 companies has earned us the trust of CIOs and C-Level executives, because we have a track record of providing business value. In our Detroit-based Innovation Studio, we showcase the latest technologies being developed by VisionIT and our partners across cloud, IoT, mobile, infotainment systems, and virtual/augmented reality. Learn more about our company by visiting www.visionit.com.

details:
AX Business Analyst

 Job Description  CFS Technology, Central Ohio’s premier IT staffing solutions provider, has been contacted by a longtime client that is currently seeking an AX Business Analyst with experience working with business groups and mapping processes, gathering requirements and testing applications.  Business Analysts —are you interested in taking the next step in your career with a global organization that will truly value your expertise? Join our team at CFS Technology!   Here at CFS, we understand the requirements of our clients and we have the resources to provide them with exceptional talent. Our client’s satisfaction is the most important part of our business, and we work hard to ensure that each placement we do is the absolute best.  Due to our continued growth, we are currently seeking seasoned individuals like you to serve as an AX Business Analyst. We will assign a dedicated recruiter who will get to know you, learn about your skills, your goals and your preferences, and then match you with just the right assignments with just the right companies, which provides you with limitless potential for success. You have the talent, drive and expertise—we have the right connections. Together, we can help you to build a better career. Contact us today!

AX Business Analyst

Job Responsibilities  As an AX Business Analyst, you will work closely with accounting users capturing requirements including process opportunities, needs for new or enhanced capabilities, training, support, and reporting needs. This role uses knowledge of business applications and accounting processes to develop and recommend appropriate configurations, reporting, and process re-engineering based on user needs and business priorities.  
Specific duties in this role include:
·         Partner with the business unit to develop understanding of their business processes, assess end-user needs.
·         Utilize expertise of application features to recommend solutions that meet business requirements
·         Provide ongoing system support
·         Create test plans for software apps, and provide training on software changes
·         Test accuracy of MS Dynamics AX enhancements and customizations.
·         Document high level, detailed accounting requirements, functional designs including flow charts including current/future state, gaps, training materials, and end-user docs.
·         Support user system audit.


AX Business Analyst

 Requirements
 
We are looking for an experienced AX Business Analyst who combines strong analytical and organizational skills with solid prioritization and attention to detail abilities. You must have sound judgment and strong reasoning skills, as well as good analytic and problem-solving abilities. Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills utilized within a diverse cultural environment are critical as well.  Specific requirements for this position include:
·         BA in Computer Science, IT, Accounting or Finance preferred.
·         2 years’ experience in process analysis, with 1-2 years supporting finance and accounting.
·         2+ years’ experience working with MS Dynamics AX 2012 as system admin.
·         Experience generating system and/or custom reports and workflows in Dynamics AX.
·         Familiar with INCOTERMS and International Trade.
·         Familiar with accounting processes, i.e., GL, AP, AR, inventory/month-end process preferred.
·         Familiar with Apparel business preferred.
·         Experience with Atlas 5.1 or above preferred.
·         Experience with Management Reporter 2012 and Power Bl preferred.
·         Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team, in a diverse cultural environment.

AX Business Analyst

 Build a rewarding long-term career with us at CFS—when we knock, doors open.  Apply now!

We work closely with our clients to better understand their specific needs, which ensures that each placement we do is the absolute best.
title: Business Analyst

details: REQUIRED TO INTERVIEW ON SITE IN BROOKLYN, NEW YORK - NO PHONE OR SKYPE INTERVIEW BEFORE HAND. THIS IS A 35 HOUR WORK WEEK- MONDAY THRU FRIDAY. RESPONSIBILITIES: This person will act as an Agile Business Analyst and Quality Assurance for the FTA Tool Project. As Business Analyst a consultant in this position will be responsible for meeting with stakeholders in order to define the strategy, build the roadmap and guide the development process for the FTA project and changes necessary for eArraignment application to receive data from FTA application. This role is critical to the overall success of the project. In details, BA responsibilities will include: Prepare for and perform Elicitation of Business Analysis Information Conduct Interviews, direct observations, JAD sessions, etc.to gather customer requirements and translate into product back log Participate in scrum daily stand ups Document new features, requirements, and strategies Work with business owners to prioritize feature development, based on business value Review, analyze, and document business systems and user requirements producing deliverables such as use cases, user stories, acceptance criteria, UI mockups, test cases, functional specifications, workflow process diagrams, Data Dictionary, data flow / data model diagrams Coordinate UAT As QA Analyst a consultant in this position will execute required test scenarios to make sure FTA application and related components of integrated applications function according to the business requirements. In details, QA Analyst responsibilities will include: Contribute to review of the requirements and other project design and planning documents in collaboration with Project Manager, Development team, QA lead and QA Analyst for other components, provide QA comments and sign off Learn functionality and existing test process for the eArraignment application to understand required integration scenarios Learn DOITT application delivery standards and procedures Develop test strategy and test scenarios for FTA application Load and maintain requirements and test scripts into the Quality Center Acquire / create / verify test data Execute test cases according to test plan Work with project teams to track, report and resolve defects using Quality Center Assist support team in the deployments Contribute to identifying appropriate test cases for sanity testing, regression testing Identify test scenarios suitable for test automation Contribute to identifying scenarios for performance testing Make sure all assigned tasks status is properly reported and documented Execute all other QA tasks in the SDLC process AttTest Strategy & test plan Detailed Test Cases Test Scripts Traceability matrix Test estimates Progress report for test execution Defect report end project team meetings as necessary MANDATORY SKILLS/EXPERIENCE At least 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst and QA Analyst 2+ years of experience in Agile(SCRUM) projects Experience in gathering business, technical, and functional requirements for large-scale IT projects Proven experience in requirements elicitation and defining requirements for solutions in multiple-entity environments (multiple agencies, business partners, etc.) Experienced with formal SDLCs, Business Analysis and Quality Assurance methodologies; Working knowledge of business analysis and QA documentation standards Experienced with project management methods (waterfall vs agile) Experience using an automated requirements management tool (preferably CaliberRM) Experience using SDLC management tools to track and execute test processes, Quality Center is preferable Must be proficient computer user with experience using standard productivity tools including Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio for documents development and data preparation Excellent oral and written communication/soft skills and the ability to clearly articulate to all project members and stakeholders; must be a team player who works well with technical and non-technical resources Must take initiative, be a decisive decision-maker and show confidence in decisions made Must be able to assist in validation of technical requirements for integrating data systems Must be able to take strategic direction from executive management and participate in strategic planning activities throughout the lifetime of the project Must be able to see tasks through to completion without significant guidance Strong issue resolution and investigation skills Ability to articulate and document the steps taken to resolve an issue Experience in performing end-to-end test process for complex enterprise solutions Experience in covering requirements with test cases Experience with specifics of functional and compatibility testing of browser based UI (HTML based) Understanding of the purpose and scope of performance testing process and tools DESIREABLE SKILLS/EXPERIENCE: Bachelor or Masters degree in Computer Science, or Mathematics is desired; Understanding of relational databases concept, ability to design SQL query and use them for QA tasks, Understanding components of enterprise web based application, n-tier and SOA based architecture Understanding of the specifics of testing backend components and integration based on various technologies (ETL, web services, etc.) Experience with test automation using record/play back and/or custom coded scripts tools using UFT/QTP or Selenium or other open source tools QA certification is a plusExperis is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA)

title: Business Analyst

details:
An exciting opportunity exists to join ProAssurance, a specialty writer of professional liability, products liability and workers' compensation insurance.  With over 950 employees operating in 40 states, the company is well positioned to offer career opportunities to individuals interested in professional growth.

We are currently searching for a Business Analyst in our Birmingham, Alabama office. The primary responsibility of the Business Analyst is to gather information and analyze the business processes, procedures, and systems.  The Business Analyst communicates best practices and modifications to improve these processes and monitors any changes to make sure they are effective, as well as provides documentation, testing and support.  This position develops requirements specifications, drives the design or review of test cases, and creates change request documents as necessary.  The Business Analyst accomplishes this by eliciting business requirements through the use of interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, scenarios, business analysis and task and workflow analysis.   

Qualified candidates should have a Bachelor's degree and at least three years' of experience.  Candidates must also possess strong writing skills, leadership abilities, and documentation acumen.  Strong analytical and project management skills are also required, as is a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.  Agile Scrum experience is preferred.




ProAssurance is dedicated to the principles of Treated Fairly, and that is especially meaningful in our relationships with our employees. We reward effective, enthusiastic employees with a competitive salary and incentive package.  We also provide a comprehensive suite of benefits such as a 401(k) with employer match, medical, dental, vision, long and short term disability, life insurance and education assistance.  Visit www.proassurance.com to learn more about the company and our commitment to Treated Fairly.

details:
Business Analyst


Business Analyst


Business Analyst

Our client, a large employer in Earth City, is seeking a Business Analyst to join their growing team! This is a full-time, temp to hire opportunity, and will pay between $23.00 - $26.00 per hour. The ideal candidate in this role will be someone who is highly analytical with experience analyzing large data sets and tables. This candidate should have a high degree of accuracy, strong attention to detail, and a team-oriented personality.  

Job Duties:

Help define metrics, refine and prioritize reporting, and build predictive capabilities
Partner with the team leaders and other managers to collaborate on what data and insights are most helpful in driving better business decisions
Work with team members across the organization to define and track the most impactful business metrics
Lead efforts regarding data interpretation and trending
Perform complex data analyses and deliver insights from data sets, sharing with department supervisors and managers to help with business decisions
Identify reporting and analytical needs to facilitate the use of data and analysis to make informed decisions
Proactively research and define how the organization can better use data to drive business
Engage with executive leadership to advise of guidance/direction based on data analyses
Demonstrate creative thinking to bring new ideas to the organization 

Requirements:

3-5 years prior experience in business analyst or data analyst position required
Bachelor's degree required - major in finance, accounting, engineering, or math/statistics highly preferred
Experience with SQL and/or Oracle Business Intelligence highly preferred
Experience in Tableau or Spot fire is a plus
Strong MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Access skills required
Ability to work on an individual basis and as part of a collaborative team
Excellent attention to detail with a high level of accuracy required
Per the client's request, the ability to pass a pre-employment drug screen and background check

Ref ID: 02760-0010350580Classification: Database DeveloperCompensation: $125,000.00 to $130,000.00 per yearPOSITION SUMMARY: The BI Technical Lead will be responsible for working closely with the product owner to ensure reporting and design requirements are met. This person will be responsible for the training and mentoring of a group of Microsoft BI developers, and assigning tasks based on the priorities outlined by the product owner. The Technical Lead is responsible for ensuring the proper data is available to achieve the business objective for reporting and analysis across all areas of the enterprise. The technical domain includes conceptual, logical and physical data modeling, data standards, best practices, tool and technologies, data architecture, design, development, capacity planning, performance tuning, and administration. This role requires someone with strong technical backgrounds in data modeling tools as well as application development. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: ? Works with BI Specialist and development team to design, plan implement, evaluate and enhance system architecture. ? Provides direction and oversight of the process of conceptual and logical data modeling. ? Validates user requirements are supported by the database schema design. ? Performs detailed data analysis and source data quality assessment. ? Designs and develops entity and attributes model descriptions and definitions and ensures that conflicts in descriptions and definitions are resolved. ? Designs, develops and maintains the subject area models (integrated, analytical/dimensional). ? Responsible for developing information architectures and data models. ? Develops detailed technical designs and works with cross-functional teams to implement those designs. ? Assist business analysts and reporting tool specialists in configuring the reporting tool and building standard reports/queries. ? Leads the design of the schema and data dictionary (metadata). ? Identifies the appropriate data sources with Business. ? Performs the activities necessary to support the standardization of entities and attributes. ? Assists analysts in source to target mappings. Specifies appropriate access levels to the databases through SQL Server security ? Leads any system migrations and major upgrades

EXPERIENCE AND BACKGROUND REQUIREMENTS: ? 7+ years of experience in technical architecture and application delivery ? Worked in an Architect/Technical Lead level ? Trained junior developers ? AGILE experience preferred ? Depth and breadth of both knowledge and hands-on implementation experience with Microsoft BI Stack: Microsoft SQL 2014, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS. ? Proficient in creating and maintaining SSAS OLAP cubes following star schema patterns and dimensional modeling best practices in SQL Server 2012 or newer, as well as data partitioning. ? Understands Microsoft SQL Server error logging for troubleshooting and incident reporting; proficient in SQL Profiler for providing query traces ? Ability to lead and mentor development team. ? Excellent verbal and written communication skills. EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: ? BS in Computer Science, Information Systems or related fieldTechnology doesn't change the world. title: Business Analyst

category: Information Technology, Engineering, QA - Quality Control
details:
To ensure that business needs are met through the optimization of our current technical system capabilities, matching problem areas in the organization with a solution through lean methods, research of capital expenditure, process improvements or existing system application.

ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:


Collaborate with the PMO team and other department teams to understand the scope and vision of their issue and determine an effective solution from existing systems. Conduct interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Work with the user to collect requirements, establish appropriate test criteria and work with PMO to develop a solution if one does not exist. Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team. Collaborate with IT once a decision is made to effectively test, train, document, and implement the solution.
Support business processes by thoroughly understanding the technical and business solutions available and/or work with the PMO team to create solutions.
Assist in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts.
Participate in the QA of purchased solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized.
Develop and utilize standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications.
Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to the PMO, IT and the user.
Where applicable, develop prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on the user requirements.
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are being met.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements– verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Provide solutions that reflect the business intent and will result in the desired business behavior.
Test and ensure quality of internally developed reports, websites, spreadsheets, NAV changes, etc. that are developed to meet the gathered requirements and be able to write documentation for internally developed products


Requirements: 



EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: Completed a high school diploma or general education degree (GED) required. Degree in Project Management, Business Operations or equivalent: or 2-4-years related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience. Significant use of Microsoft Office, SharePoint, Navision and ERP systems.  
Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status.

LANGUAGE SKILLS: Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, memos, emails, SOP’s, labeling instructions and other materials required. Ability to write legible short correspondence. Ability to effectively present information to other employees of the organization. Must effectively demonstrate the ability to communicate in English, both verbally and in written format.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS: Ability to add, subtract, and multiply applying mathematical concepts when needed.

REASONING ABILITY: Ability to apply common sense understanding and carry out instructions furnished in written and oral form.

PHYSICAL DEMAND: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand majority of the time, walk, lift and see, talk or hear. The employee is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb, step down or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 55 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job majority of the time include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus on a continuous basis.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: Temperature controlled facility. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud.

There is no smoking or tobacco use of any kind in any of our buildings including our parking lots. If you want to smoke or use tobacco products, you need to leave our company premises. This applies to our employees and any visitors.


As a member of our team you will be eligible for great benefits that include: health and dental insurance, voluntary benefits (vision, disability, etc.), 401(k) with company match, paid time off, holiday time off, corporate wellness plan and bonus opportunities.

Stop working a job and start your career with a company that is dedicated to your success. Apply today

title: Business Analyst

details: Job Description If you are an experienced Business Analyst looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help! We are a leading staffing firm and our clients include some over the nation’s biggest companies. Our client has a need for a Business Analyst. This is a contract position; however it is not uncommon for assignments to transition into permanent positions with our client companies. If you have the background we are looking for, and you are interested in an opportunity to get your foot in the door with leading company, we want to talk with you!  Business Analyst          Job Responsibilities                                                Your specific duties as a Business Analyst will include:         Analyzes company functions, processes, and activities to improve computer-based business applications for the most effective use of money, materials, equipment, and people. Utilizes available computer systems resources and personnel to carry out analysis to support management's quest for performance improvement. Reviews and analyzes information, forecasts, methods, schedules, systems, processes, and procedures. Determines most useful business solutions for the company. Recommends alternative solutions to management as to courses of action that best meet the organization's goals. Performs duties concerned with the design and improvement of computer-based business systems. Works closely with senior managers to identify and solve a variety of computer-based business system problems. Analyzes requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing or to improve existing business systems. Confers with personnel of organizational units involved to analyze current operational procedures and identify problems. Solicits from management symptoms of problem, formally defines the problem, breaks problem into component parts, and gathers information about each of these parts from a variety of sources. Selects the most appropriate analytical technique. Utilizes several study techniques including simulation, linear and nonlinear programming, dynamic programming, queuing and other stochastic-process models, Markov decision processes, econometric methods, data envelopment analysis, neural networks, expert systems, decision analysis, and the analytic hierarchy process. Writes description of business needs, business program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer-based business systems. Reviews computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations to determine if requested program or program change is possible within existing system. Studies existing computer-based business systems to evaluate effectiveness, and develops new systems to improve production or workflow as required. This position provides a wide array of weekly and ad-hoc tasks depending on project size and staffing. Collecting and maintaining data for the Project work stream plan Validating of required reports; Assisting with maintenance, tracking and resolution of issues and action items. Collecting and maintaining project plan and schedule data, working in conjunction with Project Scheduler. Elevating risk triggers to Project Manager. Updating and maintaining living documents. Assisting with QA, test planning, test execution and resolution of defects found. Coordinating technical dependencies with other work streams. Maintain risk register, issues and action item logs. Maintain project living documents. Work shop coordination and participation. Collection of data for status reporting. Producing business process maps. Document business requirements. Tracing process mapping to business requirements. Ensuring traceability of project scope and functional requirements to technical requirements. Conducting gap analyses of final technology solutions against both functional and technical requirements.    Business Analyst Job Requirements As a Business Analyst you must represent our company well by being responsible, punctual and motivated to go above and beyond the call of duty. You must also be highly detail-oriented and organized with excellent analytic and problem-solving abilities. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.  0-3 years’ experience. The individual needs to be able to work independently and a self-starter with the ability to work in a large matrix organization requiring collaboration with IT and across business support teams including Change Management, Business Process Management, Training and Business PMO/Governance. Strong analytical and technical background. Familiar with application development and delivery lifecycle. Project experience in technology deployments from a business perspective. Experienced with the use of MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word. Comfortable with presenting materials to all levels of management.    Business Analyst Benefits  As a Business Analyst with Bartech, you will be working through an established and respected staffing organization with 40 years of serving as a trusted partner to our client companies. We are dedicated to providing our talent with personal, responsive attention, and will assign an employee care representative to answer any questions or concerns that you might have. Depending upon the client, the assignment and your performance, you can find potential opportunities for direct employment. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with competitive compensation, including benefits. Available benefits for Business Analyst Position may include (but are not limited to):  Exceptional medical, dental, and vision 401(k) Paid time off, including holidays  Make the most of your experience! Apply now!  Applicant must be eligible to work in the US for immediate opening.

title: Business Analyst

category: Information Technology, Professional Services, Business Development
details:
SENIOR (PEOPLESOFT FINANCIALS) BUSINESS ANALYST
Seeking a Sr. Business Analyst who will work with users to define and document system requirements for new Financials Cloud implementation.  The Business Analyst (BA) will also contribute to other IT business or sponsored technology projects by translating basic to complex business needs into understandable requirements. Business Analysts participate in the development and management of project plans related to application development initiatives, from project planning (business & strategic) and design, testing, implementation and maintenance. 
 
General responsibilities include: Facilitate requirements gathering and design sessions, review design documentation with users and developers, prepare process and data models, prioritize system functionality based on requirements, coordinate pilot and test activities, and design screens and reports.  
BUSINESS ANALYST (PeopleSoft Financials) RESPONSIBILITIES
·   The Business Analysts educate project team members and the business community on the impact of the proposed technology, as well as developing contingency plans.  
·  Responsible for production support for assigned systems, ensuring an efficient and smooth production environment by working with the developer and applying patches and fixes to the system upon failure of the system.
·  Responsible for ensuring the least amount of downtime or inefficient production for assigned systems.  Work with the developer and/or DBA to “tune” the system to ensure the most efficient system within available resources.
·         Use an in-depth understanding of the system to write reports for users and/or clients from systems which aid in business decision making.
·         The Business Analysts develop and conduct user training on system(s) functionality.
·         Work with internal users to understand system needs and develop plans for meeting those needs.
·         Assist in large scope projects or lead activities in small to medium scope projects during analysis, design, construction and testing phases of projects.
·         Facilitate in requirements and design sessions for smaller to medium scope projects and participate in the requirements and design sessions for large scope projects.
·         Define and document functional and system specifications.
·         Develop process flows, system flows, and data models using modeling and process tools.
·         Prioritize system and data functionality requirements based on user needs and project constraints.
·         Review design documentation with users and developers.
·         The Business Analysts work with vendors/vendor packages to ensure that system requirements are understood.
·         Write test plans and test cases in compliance with relevant organizational and industry standards.
·         Creates clearly documented defect reports that enable a developer or technician to recreate the defect. May clear defect reports.
·         Maintain and update test documentation, user guides, release notes, and help notes to ensure the accuracy of applications and related documentation.
·         Executes end-to-end functional tests and utilizes automated tests developed by others to exercise system. Collaborates to achieve end-to-end product and process quality.
·         The Business Analysts also provide information, analysis and recommendations to support the product.
·         Understands the business needs the product is trying to meet and applies this understanding to guide testing. Applies a comprehensive understanding of the product functions and the marketplace in which it is sold effectively test assigned products

BUSINESS ANALYST (PeopleSoft Financials) REQUIREMENTS


Experience with PeopleSoft Financials (GL/AP/FA/nVision)

A considerable understanding of current and emerging IT products, services, processes, and methodologies, along with a continuing understanding of the business function and process. 
Ability to understand business requirements, goals, and risks, to formulate and define the technical scope and objectives of projects.
Has a team orientation and is focused on improving business operations at all times.

“POTENTIAL NICE-TO-HAVE”: Oracle HCM Cloud and/or ALM experience/knowledge
title: Business Analyst

details:
The Role:
As part of our team, you will plan, design, develop, and launch efficient business, financial, and operations systems in support of core organizational functions and business processes. This role involves 60% technical business analyst work and 40% quality assurance testing of the product based on the requirements you draft.  Position will elicit, specify, and validate the business needs of a project sponsor or end user, and will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT system investments.  Our testing environment is currently 100% manual but will rely on VB or Python scripting for automated testing.
 
Responsibilities:
●  Collaborative define and design projects by working with both business and technical staff
●  Elicit requirements from your clients, customers, and stakeholders.
●  Using those requirements, author use cases with detailed, clearly articulated business objectives and acceptance criteria.
●  Solicit feedback before, during, and after the development of projects in order to better iterate upon and refine the design and user experience.
●  Prepares detail work plan and schedule, completes analysis and research, identifies options, and recommends actions or changes for assigned projects.
●  Facilitate meetings when appropriate
●  Identify and document issues and assist in issue resolution.
●  Proactively and objectively evaluate and identify areas in our processes or product that can be streamlined, reorganized, or better positioned and create projects that execute on your ideas.
●  Serve as Subject Matter Expert and Trainer for platforms
●  Define and perform functional system setup and setup documentation preparation.
●  Assist in definition and execution of user training and documentation preparation.
●  Test projects as they are developed ensuring that the acceptance criteria were met to your and your stakeholder’s satisfaction.
●  Understand the personas of your users and know their motivations and goals.
●  Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems, and other post-implementation support.
●  Perform regression testing.
               




Required Qualifications:
●  HS Diploma or GED equivalent
●  5+ years’ experience as an IT Business Analyst
●  5+ years’ experience in Quality Assurance Testing; At least three (3) years testing in an SDLC environment including three (3) years creating test plans and test cases.
●  Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development.
●  Extensive practical knowledge in importing data for use in report software, spreadsheets, graphs, and flow charts.
●  Fast learner of new tools, processes and methodologies.
●  Strong knowledge of system testing metrics, best practices and methodologies.
●  Experience generating use cases, UML, or other similar formal software documentation frameworks.
●  Experience preparing and maintaining data for execution of test cases.
●  Hands-on experience with ad-hoc query programs, especially SQL.
●  Industry background in payroll, HR, health insurance, employee benefits solutions is a plus.

title: Business Analyst

details:
The Technical Business Analyst will participate in technology discovery activities business process evolution for technology initiatives focused on delivering strategic capabilities in areas including: security, 3rd party performance management, data and risk management.  Additionally, will play an important collaboration role in the implementation of other technology capabilities.  This position will formulate, implement, and drive strategies that optimize agility, speed, creativity and flexibility and leverage deep understanding of business process, technology, and industry best practices to deliver solutions that support the overall business intent, while acting as a role model for the principles, philosophies, and values of the company.
Responsibilities:

Draft business requirements, including Use Cases, functional and non-functional requirements and exceptions
Define and document end to end processes and supporting data flows
Translate Use Cases and functional requirements into component technical specifications
Define technology requirements and strategies to support business requirements
Participate in test planning, execution and defect management
Utilize worksheet and database skills to manipulate and analyze quantitative data
Work independently to analyze business / technology issues and develop alternatives and recommendations
Work with project management, design, delivery and support teams to develop workplans and milestone plans
Lead solution delivery; serve as full time or interim technology or project management lead on smaller technology initiatives or project components
Identify, plan and manage technology interdependencies
Proactively identify and mitigate or troubleshoot system issues
Source and assess external resources to support IT and company stakeholders
Safeguard the company’s assets
Adhere to the company’s compliance program
Maintain knowledge of industry standards, methodologies, processes, and best practices
Maintain a service-oriented, customer-focused mindset that supports ongoing operations and drives efficiency, quality, customer service and growth
Ability and willingness to travel as necessary with the United States and internationally


Required Qualifications:

BA/BS in Information Technology or related field
Minimum of 5 years of IT experience in Digital Retail / web development
Experience in the automotive marketing and sales (a plus)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills including development of business and technical requirements and delivering presentations to peer groups, and associates
Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills
Demonstrated project management and planning skills
Strong understanding of project management life cycle and system development life cycle methodologies and procedures, including Agile
Must be an energetic, forward-thinking and creative individual with high ethical standards and an appropriate professional image
Must be a well-organized and self-directed individual who is "politically savvy" and a team player
Must be an intelligent and articulate individual who can relate to people at all levels of an organization and possesses excellent communication skills
Proven success in a fast-paced environment and relevant experience with e-commerce and digital business models
Prior success in scoping, planning and driving business development initiatives within matrixed organizations
Knowledge of organization policies and procedures
Must be able and willing to participate as individual contributor where situation requires
Must have ability to work the time necessary to complete projects and/or meet deadlines

*Candidates must be local and have authorization to work in the U.S. for any employer. No third parties.

details:
NTT DATA, Inc., a top 10 global IT services company, has an immediate need for a Sr. Business Analyst for Market Research to support our client in New York, NY To apply for this position, please follow the link below or send your resume directly to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] For more information please call Melissa Torrisi at732-362-2604.   Contract Opening 6+ months NY, NY  Sr. Business Analyst supporting a Market Research/Reporting project: The organization supports a syndicated research function providing valuable real-world data across the US and robust reporting and analytics capabilities to clients. The function is currently seeking opportunities to improve the platform and services it offers. This role will be expected to drive this effort, identify opportunities to improve platform, and recommendations on path forward.
 Market Research/Reporting Experience and market research and reporting platforms as a service is a plus
Core Responsibilities: Synthesize information from various departments enabling the project team to make key strategic decisions in a timely manner.  Stellar documentation skills with the ability to articulate complex topics in a concise and articulate manner. Understand data needs and compose data queries, analysis and reports and garner a thorough understanding of data output and potential business implications. Create process flows that map current procedures and workflows. Manage and drive decision making process amongst key stakeholders.  Develop customized analytical reports to meet requests of external and internal customers. Drive effective follow up, including data and information delivery and next steps.  Experience writing use cases containing clearly articulated needs, features and acceptance tests.  Sr. Business Analyst will be required to analyze business process flows and impact on technology flows.  Sr. Business Analyst be required to translate regulatory requirements into functional technical requirements  Sr. Business Analyst writes user’s stories in an iterative fashion, liaising with the developers, product owners and other business analysts within the scrum team.  Ability to collaborate with business and technology teams to understand requirements and share with the technical team.  Provide training and on-going support for system processes and policy-based procedures Attend meetings and daily communication sessions to keep abreast of project objectives, process workflows and progress of business concepts Effectively communicate and message with experience in communicating to senior leadership. Proven experience with project management (e.g., data inventory, rationalization, and migration preferred) including the capacity to manage multiple projects and priorities at an extremely fast-paced schedule. 
Prior Experience/Requirements: 4-7 years of management experience as a business analyst or similar role (e.g., consultant, product management, program delivery, etc.). Prior consulting, business intelligence, data analytics, and business development experience is a plus. Designing, implementing, and/or assessing t of controls, including an intimate understanding of the systems implementation lifecycle, as well as configuring and optimizing business process controls and application security Excellent interpersonal and communication skills - oral, written, and listening with the ability to communicate with a broad range of stakeholders at all levels.  Detail oriented with excellent analytical skills and critical thinking capabilities; must be able to identify, troubleshoot, and present findings in spreadsheet and/or graphical format with a clear and objective accompanying narrative. Strong Microsoft PowerPoint experience and ability to effectively develop and convey communication Ability to work well under pressure in an environment with frequently shifting priorities and to consistently meet project deadlines, and can work independently and be a team player. Must be proactive and demonstrate initiative and follow-up to bring outstanding issues to completion. Strong business acumen and the ability to quickly learn and absorb new information. Previous leadership experience. Experience using project management methodologies and standards. Demonstrated effective collaboration across an organization for new processes and internal operations. Ability to prioritize multiple projects simultaneously and manage deadlines as required.
   NTT DATA is a leading IT services provider and global innovation partner with 130,000 professionals based in over 50 countries. NTT DATA recently acquired Dell Services.  NTT DATA emphasizes long-term commitment and combines global reach and local intimacy to provide premier professional services, including consulting, application services, business process, IT outsourcing, and cloud-based solutions. title: Business Analyst

details:
Overview
Envision Physician Services is a multispecialty physician group and practice management company. Established in 1953, our organization provides anesthesia, emergency medicine, hospital medicine, radiology, primary/urgent care, surgical services, and women’s and children’s health services to hospitals and health systems nationwide. Sheridan Healthcare, EmCare, Reimbursement Technologies and Emergency Medical Associates have recently joined forces to form Envision Physician Services.  As one organization, we now provide a greater scope of service than any other national physician group. Our collective experience from hundreds of local, customized engagements, culture of continuous lean process improvement, and team of experts in the business of healthcare enable us to better solve complex problems and consistently give healthcare organizations confidence in our execution. Our combined organization serves more than 780 healthcare facilities in 48 states and the District of Columbia.  If you are looking for a stable, fast-paced, growing company in the healthcare industry that is committed to innovation, excellence and integrity, then this may be a great next step in the advancement of your career.We currently have an exciting opportunity available for an experienced Business Analyst II. 

Responsibilities
The Business Analyst II role is to identify, document, and provide work estimates for radiology platform integration and deployment projects. May work on more strategic and larger scale initiatives as needed. 
Partner with internal subject matter experts to elicit requirements that best meet business needs and properly document business, user, functional, and non-functional requirements for platform deployments. 
Leverage tools and templates to estimate level of effort and cost associated with work to deploy/integrate platforms, and populate financial models with project information.
Publish meeting notes to summarize and communicate estimates and projected impacts.
Partner with IT and business teams to discuss functional design concepts, validate assumptions, and follow through with problem resolution.
Translate requirements to with project team to ensure clear understanding.
Produce professional quality work products such as project summaries, diagrams, and estimates.
Demonstrate the ability to learn new techniques and adapt to using the tools aligned with the organization, i.e. Kaizen Tools. 
Establish processes to intake and manage new requests
Assist in weekly/monthly status update presentations
Participate and promote a knowledge-sharing environment.
Provide timely, comprehensive verbal and written status reports.
Provide application demonstrations and training as required.
Other duties as needed




Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university and 3 or more years of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Knowledge of the Healthcare a plus.
Experience working on project teams associated with deployment of new technology in business to business environment.
Familiarity with IT implementations, healthcare specific domain expertise is a plus.
Experience developing documents to propose new projects, outline project requirements/designs, and estimate cost for new projects
History of developing content to support project estimates and project business cases/justifications
Ability to work on multiple projects in a fast paced environment
Challenge traditional thinking and suggest innovative and new solutions
Demonstrate leadership ability and act as a role model through actions and demeanor.
Quickly understand business processes and the underlying business need filled by the process.
Excellent oral and written communication skills to communicate with all levels of management and team members.
Demonstrate a solid understanding of work initiatives and require little guidance.
3-5 years of relevant work experience.
Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel and Powerpoint
Business Intelligence Tools, including Tableau a plus
If you are ready to join an exciting, progressive company and have a strong work ethic, join our team of experts! We offer a highly competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package.  Envision Physician Services uses E-Verify to confirm the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, please visit www.dhs.gov/E-Verify.   Envision Physician Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer.#CB#LI-JF1

title: Business Analyst

details: IT Business Analyst - Senior Top Criteria: - Strong Facilitation Skills - Expert level in requirements elicitation and documentation skills of User Stories, System Use Cases, Functional Requirements, Non-Functional Requirements and Business Rules. - Expert Level Business and System Modeling skills using BPMN and/or UML. Producing BPMN Process Models, UML Activity Diagrams, UML Use Case Diagrams, UML State Diagrams, UML Sequence Diagrams, etc. - High level of comfort interacting with business stakeholders/product managers as well as the dev/tech team on a day to day basis. General Summary: IT Business Analyst - Senior works as a liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems. The Business Analyst - Senior understands business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and recommends solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals and overall business strategies. Level Expectations: Possess advanced knowledge of the tools and processes required by the role. Function well in large-scale, highly complex, cross-functional / platform environment. Solid individual performance, but may spend considerable portion of their time providing direction for others. Share knowledge, coach and mentor Standard level resources in area of expertise. May serve as technical lead in area of expertise. May have duties instructing, directing, and checking the work of others. Good communication and relationship skills, both in directing the technical team and updating leadership. Essential Functions: - Perform analysis of business issues, provide recommendations for possible solutions, work with Business users and IT project teams to drive decision making and define requirements for application development, ensuring that business needs are being met. - Complete documentation for business requirements, which guide application development efforts, working closely with the development team and business teams to ensure successful implementation of business requirements. - Assist with the development and maintenance of the business requirements process used to define requirements for systems projects, assist with the definition and negotiation of project scope and create appropriate scope documentation. - Analyze opportunities to improve application reliability, provide recommendations for possible solutions, and work with IT and Business partners to implement solutions that enhance application and infrastructure reliability. - Work with IT and Business partners to build support processes and procedures provide ongoing support to manage application SLAs, resolve a majority of the problems and fulfill service requests that do not require application development. - Perform analysis of compliance vulnerabilities; work with IT and Business teams to eliminate vulnerabilities, support internal and external audit related activities. - Communicate project status and escalates issues as needed. Qualifications: - 4 - 6 years of experience in business analysis of product or software development. - Experience with various development methodologies is highly desired. - Proven organizational skills with the ability to develop a detailed work plan to ensure project success. - Demonstrated ability to organize and facilitate large cross-functional meetings. Promoted consensus on a high level view of the project and drill down into the details to obtain the requirements. - Performed thorough requirement interviews with project stakeholders. - Ability to document project issues, risks, assumptions and requirements. - Demonstrated problem solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively with other departments to resolve issues. - Ability to analyze and develop business scenarios and use cases. - Follow policies and procedures to ensure audit and corporate compliance. - Consistently deliver project status and time tracking regularly to management. - Demonstrated understanding of system design concepts. - Conduct comprehensive requirements reviews with project stakeholders, development and QA teams. - Creating process flows and diagrams necessary to assist the requirements gathering process. Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong facilitation, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills. - Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handling multiple priorities. - General PC knowledge including Microsoft Office expert level knowledge of Excel, working knowledge of Access, In-depth knowledge of SQL preferred - Working knowledge of SharePoint required. - Working knowledge of Atlassian Agile tools like Jira and Confluence is a definite plus
title: Business Analyst

details:
Oracle Business Analyst




Uline – Shipping Supply Specialists

"The people I work with are as passionate as I am." 
"I came to Uline for a job. Instead, I found a career."

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, packaging and industrial supplies. We're a family-owned company known for our incredible customer service and quality products. Our people make the difference.

We're looking for the best and brightest to take our Finance department to the next level. If you have passion and expertise in accounting, tax, financial analysis, international finance, credit and collections, or accounts payable, Uline is the company for you.


Uline seeks an Oracle Business Analyst at its Corporate Headquarters in Pleasant Prairie, Wisconsin (north of Chicago, Illinois). Position will be based out of Gurnee, IL office.


ORACLE BUSINESS ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES



Work closely with Accounts Payable, Accounting and Procurement staff to support Oracle EBS R12 software. 


Review and analyze business requirements and process configuration, mapping and management. 


Provide system and business support to users. 


Accurately repair, resolve and document system changes and issues. 


Document specifications and solutions to satisfy project requirements. 


Help deploy and implement application projects and enhancements. 


Monitor system performance. 


Coordinate Oracle service requests and drive them to a final resolution.



ORACLE BUSINESS ANALYST MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS


Bachelor's degree. 


Expertise with Oracle modules – Accounts Payables, General Ledger, Cash Management and Purchasing. 


Understanding of Oracle Workflow. 


Experience upgrading Oracle 11i to Oracle R12 with an understanding of the functional changes between the two versions. 


Proficient in understanding the application design, configuration / module setup and documentation of functional documents. 


Strong communication and management skills. 


Ability to troubleshoot issues and assist with support. 


Knowledge and experience with Oracle open interfaces and application programming interfaces (APIs). 


Understanding of flex fields, workflow, setup and profile options. 


Understanding of multi-organization and multi-currency functionality. 


Working knowledge of query tools (PL/SQL, Toad, SQL Plus).





ORACLE BUSINESS ANALYST BENEFITS



Complete insurance coverage – medical, dental, vision, life.




State-of-the-art fitness facilities and gourmet cafeteria. 


401(k) with company match.



Generous paid time off.



Tuition reimbursement.



3 bonus programs. 



Please visit www.uline.jobs to learn more about our job openings and benefits package.

HOW TO APPLY

Please click the “APPLY" button to submit your resume for immediate consideration! 

EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled

Uline is a drug-free workplace

ORACLE, ORACLE ANALYST, ORACLE BUSINESS ANALYST, FINANCE, ACCOUNTING, ACCOUNTS PAYABLE, PROCUREMENT, ORACLE EBS R12, CONFIGURATION, ORACLE SYSTEM, SYSTEM REPAIR, TROUBLESHOOT, ORACLE MODULES, ACCOUNTS PAYABLES, GENERAL LEDGER, CASH MANAGEMENT, PURCHASING, ORACLE WORKFLOW, ORACLE 11I, API, APPLICATION PROGRAMMING INTERFACE, QUERY TOOLS, PL, SQL, TOAD, SQL PLUS, MILWAUKEE, CHICAGO, KENOSHA, RACINE, WAUKEGAN, LAKE COUNTY

General Requirements:• Eliciting, prioritizing, analyzing, documenting, and validating detailed business requirements;• Identifying gaps between system capabilities and business requirements • Mapping capabilities to requirements to ensure that business needs are met• Leading the translation of business/ user requirements into development activities, test conditions, and expected results.• Creating technical implementation roadmaps• Ensuring compliance with standardized system development lifecycle • Applying standard software development life cycle methodologies• Structuring projects and releases• Prioritizing activities; Planning delivery • Ensuring timely completion of milestones• Providing status updates to the business stakeholders• Maintaining proper documentation and Bottom line budget-focus• Coordinating User Acceptance Testing• Assisting with the development and execution of change management and training throughout the organization during the Implementation of system solutions• Developing effective working relationships with the IT team, business users, and external vendors• Working with the end-user community to record and prioritize maintenance and development activities/needs once the system is implemented.DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS:Excellent interpersonal and communication skills  Must be able to communicate extremely effectively with all parties including business professionals and technical professionals.  Must be able to be understood by all parties; Must not have any translation restrictions or hindrances while working with multiple professionals;
Strong analytical skills and detail orientedProfessionally assertive and collegialAbility to multitaskExcellent problem solving skillsProficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)Local candidate – NY Metro AreaStable career historyPrevious Insurance / Re-Insurance ExperienceQualifications and Education Requirements A minimum of 5 - 7 years of experience in Business and Systems Analysis role. BA that came up through a developer role with strong Project Management skills Solid and successful experience in gathering requirements from the business users as well as system enhancements/bug fixes specifications. A track record of building strong relationships with business users. Strong Experience coordinating activities with developers, testing and other IT functional areas. Experience with Web application development projects is required. Excellent team player with a proven background of individual contribution. Interpersonal, documentation, communication, and presentation skills. Minimal experience with SQL is required. Must be business service focused. Experience with content management systems is highly preferred.
Be a part of the ConsultNet difference. As a leading national provider of IT staffing and solutions, ConsultNet delivers exceptional services to startup, midmarket and Fortune 1000 companies across North America. Since 1996, we've partnered with clients to create rewarding opportunities for our consultants, successfully building teams that have surefire results. In the past two years alone, we have placed more than 1,500 consultants in contract, contract-to-hire, or direct placement opportunities. We understand communication is key to finding the right job that matches your skills and career goals. For us, it's not just the work that we do; it's how we do the work. Our breadth of offerings extends to multiple IT positions in major markets throughout the country, see more at www.consultnet.com.
title: Business Analyst

details:
Job Title: IT Senior Business Analyst
Location: Dallas, TX
Job Type: Fulltime

Job Description:
The Sr. Business Analyst will work closely with our Product Owners to create user stories and technical specifications based on business requirements that will be utilized to build our NextGen platform. They will be the liaison between the product and development teams accountable for all requirements to build functional software ensuring there are no gaps between business requirements and what is being delivered by development teams. In addition, the Sr. Business Analyst will be working closely with Scrum Masters and Development leaders to adhere to Agile development processes across teams ensuring there is high collaboration and feedback with business stakeholders.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES, RESPONSIBILITIES & OUTCOMES:
Create user stories and detailed technical scenarios including acceptance criteria that support software development requests
Work with product owners to create user story goals and align team around product vision
Define scope of initial product release ensuring definition of Most Viable Product (MVP) is clearly documented and aligned upon
Assess impact of requirements changes creating a balanced approach (tradeoff between value vs. time) to decision making
Drive feature and story grooming to identify high value items and prioritize them in the backlog accordingly within team sprint planning session
Setup feature demo’s with executives and internal customers to gather feedback on functionality as it’s built out
Assist in ramp up of development Agile pods as they are onboarded ensuring new team members understand SDLC process and product backlog areas to focus on
Understanding of Architecture standards and technology solutions being utilized, working closely with Architects to align technical specifications to those standards
Analyze application and business domain data requirements to understand data flow from screen to screen
Perform requirements validation testing of development deliverables to ensure that solutions address business needs and meet acceptance criteria outlined
Enforce best practices to make continuous process improvements increasing team productivity and thereby reducing waste
Build strong relationships with key internal business and IT stakeholders and external partners
Maintain documentation of user stories and technical specifications within development tool
Assist with UX design and discovery planning to prioritize MVP features (dszehs)
gement



Experience/Skills
Bachelor Degree required, Masters Preferred
3+ years of relevant experience in highly collaborative role
3+ years of Web and/or Web Services development experience
Experience with Agile development methodology
Experience with Agile development toolsets from Atlassian suite (JIRA, BitBucket, Confluence, etc.)
Experience working with applications developed with technologies such as Java, JavaScript, Angular, Oracle, etc.
Experience working with cloud native applications and architecture
Experience with release management processes
Excellent written and, verbal, analytical and presentation skills
Excellent attention to details
Experience in the logistics/transportation industry or adjacent industries applicable to WWEX.
Organizational skills
Verbal and written communication skills
