title: Business Analyst

details:
Job Description - Business Analyst
Business Analyst 

The Business Analyst will be primarily responsible for eliciting and capturing end-user technical requirements and translating them into groomed and estimated user stories. Additionally, the Business Analyst will have varying degrees of responsibility for managing the delivery of technology development and testing, acting as the Scrum Master within the organization.

The Business Analyst will join a cross-functional team of diverse staff at our client's world headquarters, working with IT staff, assorted project delivery staff, business intelligence analysts and a team of remote developers and testers offshore.
 
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ATTITUDES, AND EXPERIENCE 

Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.
Three or more years of progressive related work experience as a Business Analyst
Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Agile development practices
User story grooming and estimating
Managing small delivery teams
Familiarity working with offshore teams
Ability to work well under pressure.
Ability to work independently and perform multiple concurrent and diversified tasks effectively.
Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent time management and organizational skills.
Dedicated team player, self-motivated and detailed oriented individual.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite


Third Party Applications Will Not Be Considered
title: Business Analyst

details: Our client is a Boston-based financial investment firm that serves over twenty million customers. They employ tens of thousands of individuals and manage trillions of dollars in assets. With almost a century of experience, this financial services company is an industry leader, both nationally and globally. Our client is known for being a great place to work, and they are looking for a Business Analyst with Investment Compliance Systems experience to join their team. Responsibilities of the Business Analyst:  Responsible for validating rule results between legacy tool and new tool Comparison of rule results and reconciliation of differences Document and categorize test results Document and track defects Responsible for writing UAT test cases, smoke testing UAT test cases, and documenting test results  Requirements of the Business Analyst:  Strong experience with compliance system conversions Knowledge of compliance rule logic Strong experience as a business analyst, preferably in investment compliance Ability to perform function independently and manage deliverables Team player with keen attention to detail and strong organizational skills  Job ID: 305483 About Eliassen Group: Eliassen Group provides strategic talent solutions to drive our clients’ innovation and business results. Leveraging nearly 30 years of success, our expertise in IT staffing, Agile consulting, creative services, managed services, and life sciences enables us to partner with our clients to execute their business strategy and scale effectively. Headquartered in Reading, MA and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence, deep networks, as well as national reach. For more information, visit http://www.eliassen.com. Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Don’t miss out on our referral program! If we hire a candidate that you refer us to then you can be eligible for a $1,000 referral check!
title: Business Analyst

details:
Hi,

We are actively hiring for IT Business Analyst II at Waltham, MA.

If interested, please respond back with your updated word format resume.No C2C/C2H. This position is on W2 only for US Citizens/ Green Card/ EAD.

 

Job Title: IT Business Analyst II

Location: Waltham, MA

Duration: 12+ Months

Job Description:

The IS/IT Cyber Security Business Analyst is responsible for assessing the business needs of the project, converting these into formal business requirements, and producing the documents that will allow the (remainder of the) project team to define, develop and implement a solution that will meet these needs. He/she will produce the Investment Proposal, Business Requirements, and the Total Cost of Ownership and provide input to a range of other project deliverables. 

Key Accountabilities: 

Delivery of analysis deliverables for medium and some large sized projects such as the investment proposal, business requirements document, and supporting analysis deliverables. 
Investigates work to determine business requirements and specify business processes, through improvements in information systems, information management, practices, procedures and organization change. Conducts investigations for strategy studies, business requirements and feasibility studies. 
Applies and monitors the use of required modeling and analysis tools. Methods and standards giving special consideration to business perspectives. 
Identifies stakeholders and their business needs. 


Knowledge & Experience Required: 

Good Leadership skills and a tracking record of ability to influence business or IS colleagues. 
Experience of undertaking roles in which analytical thinking is applied to produce business improvements within thecompany's Environment 
Knowledge of IS project development processes and wider organization units of IS is preferred but not mandatory 
An understanding of how the company is organized as a business, what the business functions do at a high level and how the company makes money 
Understanding of the purpose of business process teams and the new RIIO regulatory framework. 


Qualifications Required: 

Relevant business analysis qualification – e.g. working towards or has BCS ISEB Diploma in business analysis or similar qualification or experience that demonstrates analysis skills. 

Key Interfaces: 

Business Users 
IS Business Consultants 
Project Manager 
Solution Architects 
Partner resources 
IS Procurement, IS Finance, IS Service Delivery 


Core Business Skills: 

Commercial Awareness - Consistently takes into consideration commercial implications of actions when making decisions or setting objectives for self or others. 
Leadership & Team Working - Strongly demonstrates team working through sharing the workload to ensure the team meets its objectives. Keeps the team informed and up to date with relevant information and consistently is encouraging continuous improvement. 
Customer Focus - Shows depth of approach in communication with customers. Developing relationships with customers to address underlying needs and identify areas for improvement. 
Drive and Initiative - Without supervision will apply extra effort to meet the team’s objectives and deadlines. Demonstrates a strong determination to achieve business goals despite opposition. 
Business Analysis Techniques - Familiar with a broad range of modelling techniques. Works independently. Frequently provides advice/support to colleagues on areas of knowledge. Has proved competent to work on a few larger scale or more complex projects. Shows a desire to improve techniques and methods employed. Frequently demonstrates sound understanding of the key purpose of analysis activity. Can effectively analyse given information, identifying relevant relationships and resolving given business problems. Can independently pick up new analysis tools and techniques quickly. Analysis deliverables benefit from peer review but do not require significant rework Frequently demonstrates a sound understanding of the key objectives and strategies of the majority of business functions within the organization 
Information Capture - Demonstrates a sound knowledge of the appropriate information capture techniques appropriate for any situation. Works independently on information capture activities. Able to supervise others on the selection and use of appropriate techniques. Identifies the needs of different classes of stakeholders and knows how those needs would be catered for in the management of interviews, workshops, materials, etc. for such stakeholders. 
Communication Skills - Under minor supervision, conducts stakeholder analysis to understand communication preferences and certain characteristics. Occasionally applies analysis without supervision. Without supervision, regularly selects the most appropriate communication method based on goals and characteristics of the audience. Adapts templates to complete documents appropriate for the audience, with limited repetition of information. 
Business Process Improvement Skills - Analyses information gathered about current business processes and business aims to identify improvements at a project level, including balancing end-business aims with IS business aims. Is aware of wider issues including cultural, organisational and business constraints affecting options for change. Identifies potential alternative processes to achieve business aims. Helps assess the risks, costs, potential benefits and feasibility of the potential approaches. Facilitates cost estimation by obtaining information and costs from potential suppliers and from experience of previous projects. Prepares business cases for the recommended approach for medium sized projects. 
Project Management - Demonstrates the ability to produce plans to support the definition of schemes of some complexity. Regularly supports project control techniques, sometimes unsupervised. Identifies and manages risks associated to the project including mitigating actions and running risk workshops. 

If interested, please respond back with your updated word format resume or apply for this job for complete details.
 
Regards
Dev
title: Business Analyst

details:
Job Description - Senior Business Analyst
SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST
6+ month contract to hire
Plano, TX 

As a Technology Business Analyst, you will work directly with business partners, technology teams, and other stakeholders. You will participate in all phases of the software development life cycle to implement solutions to meet business needs, provide application support, and ensure proper technology controls and application documentation. Technology Business Analyst will actively contribute during multiple SDLC phases and is be willing to grow to engineering.

Skills/Experience You’ll Need:
Expert in at least one technology and design technique as well as experience working across large environments with multiple operating systems/infrastructure for large-scale programs (e.g., Expert Engineers) starting to be firm-wide resources working on projects across the enterprise
Multi-skilled with expertise across software development lifecycle and toolset
May be recognized as a leader in Agile and cultivating teams working in Agile frameworks
Sought out as coach for at least one technical skill
Strong understanding of techniques such as Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Test Driven Development, Cloud Development, resiliency, security
Stays abreast of cutting edge technologies/trends and uses experience to influence application of those technologies/trends to support the business; may give speeches and outside the firm, writes articles

details:
Hi,



We are actively hiring for Business Analyst at Brooklyn, NY.



Please find the details below. If interested, please respond back with your updated word format resume. No C2C/C2H. This position is on W2 for only US Citizens.



Job Title:  Business Analyst

 

Location: Brooklyn, NY

 

Duration: 30+ Months

 

Job Description:

The Client IT Program Management Office is seeking a temporary consultant to perform business, system and workflow analysis; develop specifications, User Acceptance Test (UAT) scripts and documentation in compliance with Client standards and procedures, and assist in testing systems interfaces to deliver a new 3rd party cloud based software solution to the internal business client.


RESPONSIBILITIES






Perform analysis of business processes, business and system requirements for the configuration and implementation of a new software application that supportsthe internal client business requirements







Employ structured modeling techniques and tools to describe business functions, processes, workflows, information and technology designs







Develop and maintain PDLC (Project Development Life Cycle) artifacts and gate review documentation for program development activity in a timely and high quality manner







Update and maintain MS Project schedules on weekly basis







Document As-Is and To-Be process flows for existing and future systems




 Requirements
REQUIREMENTS:

Documents detailing: (PDLC artifact documents including:)

1.      Business Requirements documentation

2.      System functionality and business process documentation

3.      Meeting agendas and minutes

4.      Test Cases, Test Plans and scripts

5.      Risk Matrices

6.      Budget tracking and variance reporting

7.      Status Reports and Action Item Logs

 

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION

·         Excellent oral and written/presentation communication skills

·         Proficiency with Microsoft Office 2013 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

·         Experience and proficiency creating and maintaining MS Project schedules



·         Strong inter-personal skills including ability to work with internal and external/vendor business and technical staff, at all levels of each organization.

title: Business Analyst

details:
Business Process Business Analyst

Optomi, in partnership with an industry leader in consumer transaction technologies for their innovative solutions, services, workplace, and environment, have an immediate opening. They are looking to bring on a Business Analyst with a broad understanding of retail business operations, software technology solutions, and industry best practices. The Business Analyst’s responsibilities will be a client facing role where you will have to navigate effectively in a multi-faceted government organization with a wide and complex range of products and business challenges. You will be the liaison between assigned business units and the IT organization to support the translation of operational needs into software specifications as well as coordinate the implementation of new or enhanced software technologies.  
What The Right Professional Will Enjoy!
●  Room for rapid career progression within the first few years. 
●  Up to 50% travel to work with fortune 500 and industry leading clients across the US.
●  Have the opportunity to build relationships and work with top C-level executives in the business. 
●  Work with other professionals with the hunger to learn and develop their IT skills further.
●  Implement change in an organization that will be rolling out your policies and roadmaps globally! 

Apply Today If Your Background Includes:
●  5+ years of experience demonstrating Business Analyst skills’ including the understanding of functional analysis for specific applications within the SDLC.
●  3+ years of experience as a Project Lead and setting project cost controls.
●  Excellent listening and analytical skills, facilitation skills, organizational skills, and the ability to lead people and help them through the challenges of change within a complex environment.
●  Planning and organizational skills necessary to prioritize and coordinate workload within a multiple project setting.
●  Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or a closely related field.



Responsibilities:
●  Works with clients and other consultants to formulate plans outlining steps required to develop the program, uses structured analysis and design. And submits to end-users for approval.
●  Conduct business needs analysis against existing technology and supporting processes to determine if area of focus is IT or business-related.
●  Assist business units in process definition and act as consultant to improve business processes.
●  Collaborate with business units, other technology areas, and vendors to identify alternative solutions and translate operational needs into IT specifications.
●  Assemble and present business requirements, functional specifications, and project statements.
●  Monitor activities of assigned projects to ensure project remains on schedule and within approved scope/budget.
●  Communicate status of each phase for assigned projects to management on a scheduled basis.
●  Execute formal change management process to adjust project scope, budget or schedule as needed.
●  Develop testing requirements and plan to validate application changes and supporting business processes.
●  Support beta testing, end-user testing and validation by business unit for new or revised applications.
●  Provide support to end-users on features and functions of applications for assigned areas.
●  Evaluate proposed changes to existing applications to identify potential adverse impact upon operations.
●  Ascertain that newly implemented/revised application and supporting processes are meeting end-user requirements and business objectives.
●  Perform modeling of business and system processes based on findings through use-case scenarios, workflow diagrams, and data models.
●  Collaborate with third-party vendors to resolve project or support issues.
●  Research/analyze current/emerging technologies/vendor services in support of business priorities and objectives.

details:
KellyMitchell matches the best IT and business talent with premier organizations nationwide. Our clients, ranging from Fortune 500 corporations to rapidly growing high-tech companies, are exceptionally served by our 1500+ IT and business consultants. Our industry is growing rapidly, and now is a great time to launch your career with the KellyMitchell team.Job Summary: Senior Business AnalystDuties: Capture AS-IS processes for raw materials, intermediates, and finished products  Partner with business teams and Product Line Quality Managers to influence and design TO-BE, regional business processes  Define processes that leverage industry standards, identify gaps where country and or location based non-standard approaches are required, and lead efforts to overcome process gaps  Create business process models that clearly illustrate how people, products, processes and data interoperate.  Collaborate and partner on ideas and requirements to achieve optimal future value, rather than simply gathering requirements  Lead and facilitate business process workshops, while capturing and consolidating inputs from multiple sources  Effectively present and communicate information and ideas to individuals  Assimilate and correlate disconnected documentation and drawings, and articulate their collective relevance  Create process models, workflows, and interaction diagrams 
Desired Skills/ Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Business or similar discipline  5+ years working experience in supply chain or related field as a business analyst.  Experience developing process maps  Must be an expert in process mapping software, like Visio, or equivalent.  Must be an expert in work visualization or calendarization/project software.  Understanding of training requirements and ability to prepare training materials.  Knowledge of computer system capabilities, business processes, and work flows  Ability to contribute to the development of new concepts, techniques, processes, and standards.  Able to develop solutions to complex problems which require ingenuity and innovation.  Ability to ensure solutions are consistent with organization’s objectives.  Exhibit high energy and the enthusiasm to work through issues providing creative solutions to challenges.  Proven ability to lead independently on complex projects with superior interpersonal skills, creative solution and problem solving skills.  Quality, LEAN, and SAP experience is preferred  Ability to multi-task and prioritize work  Strong communication, teambuilding and networking skills Attention to detail, high level organization skills, and ability to meet reporting deadlines

details:
SALESFORCE BUSINESS ANALYST BOSTON, MA 02110  The Salesforce Business Analyst will be a hands-on critical resource that will work directly on a variety of processes and systems including all aspects of product sales lifecycle. The role requires a high degree of interaction with all levels within the organization especially internal stakeholders. The candidate must possess strong interpersonal and influencing skills along with in-depth knowledge of salesforce.com.  SALESFORCE BUSINESS ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead Salesforce system projects through all aspects of project lifecycle; project planning, requirements definition, solution design and documentation, testing, deployment, and change management.



Identify opportunities for process and system improvements as well as opportunities to leverage existing systems to create strategic business advantage.



Provide functional specifications in coordination with systems architects and developers to design, configure and deliver high quality business solutions within SFDC.



Create all deployment required documentation; process flows, use cases, test scenarios and test scripts, job aides and training guides and conduct end user training and provide end-user technical support as needed.


SALESFORCE BUSINESS ANALYST REQUIREMENTS:

2-5 years of experience in a Salesforce Analyst or Implementation Consultant role.



Skilled in assisting business operations to articulate business requirements focused on efficient processes and tools. 



Direct hands-on experience implementing Salesforce applications with a broad scope.



Excellent verbal and written communication skills 



Experience with working with extended team to provide improved reporting and analytics information with a focus on self-service technologies.

details:
SR. SALESFORCE BUSINESS ANALYSTThe Intersect Group is seeking a Sr. Business Analyst to work onsite with our Dallas client to plan, design, develop, and launch efficient business, financial, and operations solutions within their Salesforce platform and services.   Must haves:
Salesforce.com Sales, Service Cloud and Marketing Cloud experience - proven experience enhancing and improving implementations
Business Analysis-mainly working with customer-facing product development teams; writing thorough requirements documents and good user stories
Consulting experience or consultative approach - someone that is solution-minded to maximize the benefit of Salesforce and connected systems
Excellent communication, facilitation & negotiation skills across the organization and able to build relationships to ensure ability to document complete requirements
AGILE SDLC experience - Must be able to work at a fast pace and under pressure
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to engage effectively with business and technical stakeholders
Excellent knowledge of MS Office Suite and Visio 
Preferred:Business knowledge of Sales, Accounting and OperationsJob Responsibilities:
Leads project by working closely with both business representatives and IT leadership to provide system designs that meet business and reporting requirements.
Acts as lead and review point for the functional requirements and designs on Salesforce initiatives assigned
Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team.
Prepares detail work plan and schedule, completes analysis and research, identifies options, and recommends actions or changes for the design portion of assigned projects
Monitors current and developing industry trends requirements in the business analysis and design arena and makes recommendations to support core business IT objectives
Develop and establish, and enforce quality assurance measures and testing standards for new applications, products, and/or enhancements to existing applications throughout their development/product lifecycles.
Develop and write test plans and scripts for tracing defects and fixes in product development, software application development, information systems and operations systems.
Perform testing and analysis of test results to ensure integration into company systems meets functional requirements, system compliance, and technical specifications.
Identify and document issues and assist in issue resolution.
Conducts and attends meetings as IT liaison with regards to systems/procedures.
Assist in implementation and/or conversion of projects.
Assist in definition and review of user training and documentation

Bachelor's degree or equivalent 
Five (5) years job-related experience in overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software systems
Three (3) years' experience in Business Analysis working on Salesforce projects, specifically within Sales Cloud and Service Cloud
Excellent knowledge of system testing metrics, best practices and Agile methodologies 
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology
Extensive practical knowledge in importing data for use in report software, spreadsheets, graphs, and flow charts.
Read, comprehend, interpret, and analyze moderately complex job-related documents and financial records
Determine when issues need to be escalated to a higher level
Work in and promote cooperation in a team environment; collaborative team player
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
Logical, efficient, keen attention to detail, highly self-motivated and self-directed and able to multi-task and manage multiple responsibilities simultaneously.
Communicate with all levels of internal personnel, both verbally and in writing

title: Business Analyst

details:
Business Analyst- On behalf of our financial client, Procom Services is looking for a Business Analyst to join their team for a great opportunity in Mount Laurel, NJ.Business Analyst Job Details 
Involves data preparation and reporting, applying analytical and technical skills, leveraging sophisticated tools/detection systems as well as defining/deploying business requirements for products/processes.
Perform detailed and timely analysis of fraud, and to partner with teammates/partners to mitigate fraud losses/detect fraud.
Utilizes diagnostics to identify system, strategy and operational issues. Explains variances and recommends remedial actions.
Converts analytical insights into recommendations for specific Fraud Operations initiatives, developing the business case and performing post-implementation tracking to ensure that targets are attained.
Mines and conducts analysis on customer, account and transactional data to create segmentation and develop fraud rules/strategies while balancing the impact to operational teams and the customer experience.
Identifies and escalates gaps in process or technology hindering efficiency and/or effectiveness of product strategies
Accountable for loss targets and the customer experience generated by fraud strategies.
Monitors and adjusts existing detection strategies to ensure continued effectiveness.
Creates management reporting for fraud metrics, strategy performance and trends analysis.
Prepares data and reporting and informs business requirements on products/processes.
Maintains on-going processes and data updates.
Acts as a subject matter expert and represents the team at system/project meetings as well as industry forums.
Maintains productive relationships with all internal stakeholders including Fraud Operations, Risk Management, Product, Retail, Finance as well as external vendors.
Becomes an SME on operational aspects of Fraud from point of compromise, exploitation, customer contact, claims processing, etc.
Business Analyst Mandatory Skills 
7+ yrs exp. as a Business Analyst in Fraud strategies/analytics environment
Proficient with SQL *able to write queries* (Data Extraction/Mining tool, Run rules, and figure out how many accounts are fraud, based on a set of rules)
Advanced Excel (V look ups, pivot tables)
Strong communication skills & a proven ability to develop effective relationships with external & internal business partners
Bachelor's degree in a numerate discipline e.g. Math, Statistics, Business
Business Analyst Nice to Have Skills 
Proficient with Knowledge Seeker (data extraction/mining tool
Proficient with data analytics tools like SAS, R, Python, SPSS Modeler
Demonstrated analytical, financial modeling and problem solving skills.
Conceptual thinker; ability to wade through data and arrive at conclusions
Strong interpersonal skills; comfortable interacting with team members of all level
 Strong communication and presentation skills. Ability to communicate strategy analysis to both technical and non-technical team members, either verbally or via documentation
Ability to take initiative and work independently under tight timelines
A high level of integrity, earning the respect and trust of her/his peer group and employees.
Strong team collaboration skills
Ability to effectively manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
Business Analyst Assignment Length3 Months + Extensions/Hire PossibleBusiness Analyst Start DateASAP**Please note that we are not able to work with candidates on H1B Visas or candidates represented by third parties

details:
Genesis10 is actively seeking a Business Analyst/PeopleSoft Financials resource for a contract position opening (contract term approximately 6 months). This position is within the financial services industry for our client located in Kansas City, MO. Description: Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for working with users to define and document system requirements for new Financials Cloud implementation. Other responsibilities will include facilitating requirements gathering and design sessions, reviewing design documentation with users and developers, preparing process and data models, prioritizing system functionality based on requirements, coordinating pilot and test activities, and designing screens and reports.Responsibilities: 

 Responsible for production support of assigned system(s) to ensure efficiency in system and production. Work with developer upon failure of system and apply patches and fixes to current system(s). Work with developer and/or DBA to "tune” the system to ensure the most efficient system(s) within available resources. .Responsible for ensuring an efficient and smooth production environment for assigned system(s) by applying patches and fixes to system or working with the developer upon failure of system. Responsible for ensuring the least amount of downtime or inefficient production for assigned system(s). Use in-depth understanding of system to write reports for users and/or clients from system(s) which aid in business decision making. Develop and conduct user training on system(s) functionality. Work with internal users to understand system needs and develop plans for meeting those needs. Assist in large scope projects or lead activities in small to medium scope projects during analysis, design, construction and testing phases of projects. Facilitate in requirements and design sessions for smaller to medium scope projects and participate in the requirements and design sessions for large scope projects. Define and document functional and system specifications. Develop process flows, system flows, and data models using modeling and process tools. Prioritize system and data functionality requirements based on user needs and project constraints. Review design documentation with users and developers. Work with vendors and vendor packages to ensure that system requirements are understood. Write test plans and test cases in compliance with relevant organizational and industry standards. Creates clearly documented defect reports that enable a developer or technician to recreate the defect. May clear defect reports. Maintain and update test documentation, user guides, release notes, and help notes to ensure accuracy of applications and related documentation. Executes end-to-end functional tests and utilizes automated tests developed by others to exercise system. Collaborates to achieve end-to-end product and process quality. Information, analysis and recommendations to support the product. Understands the business needs the product is trying to meet and applies this understanding to guide testing. Applies a comprehensive understanding of the product functions and the marketplace in which it is sold effectively test assigned products.

Requirements: Five plus years as a business/requirements analyst or business systems analyst in an information technology environment. QA Testing experience. PeopleSoft Financials (GL/AP/FA/nVision) experience. Possesses a considerable understanding of current and emerging IT products, services, processes, and methodologies, along with a continuing understanding of the business function and process Ability to understand business requirements, goals, and risks, in order to formulate and define the technical scope and objectives of projects Demonstrated facilitation skills for capturing requirements Effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills Demonstrated decision making, analytical and problem solving skills Effective time management and organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple priorities.

8163911 – Business Analyst (Regulatory Controls)
Length of contract – 1 year
Rate –$720 daily
The person will perform a Business Analyst role within the Regulatory Controls - Compliance IT team.  Focus will primarily be on our existing Sanctions Filtering platform. The IT & business platform within this scope is PRIME / Corporate & Institutional Banking.
 
Job Profile:
Conduct detailed BA work for Sanctions Filtering IT (Compliance) team.  Specific duties include:  
n   Analyze functional & system processes, do data-mapping, extract data to validate
n   Develop/Write Business Requirements with Compliance users, 
n   Create Functional & Technical Specifications document,
n   Develop & Execute Test plan (Including writing Test Cases, and Traceability Matrix).
n   Provide on-going support of the Sanctions Filtering application – PRIME’s OFAC Reporter
n   Work with Compliance to identify appropriate methodology to cover various scenarios and validate existing setup.
 
Knowledge of Corporate Banking business & systems, and Sanction Filtering is needed.  Proficiency in SQL, and Excel is also required.
 
Success in the role is heavily dependent on the ability to work cooperatively with both business users and technical team. 



REQUIRED SKILL
1.        5-7 years of experience in Corporate and Institutional Banking IT, with a full understanding of the Corporate Banking activity
2.        Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical issues in a simple concise manner
3.        Experience in writing – PID, Business Requirements doc, Functional Specifications and Test Plans for Corporate and Institutional Banking.

5.        Experience with implementing and managing of Sanctions Filtering tools like PRIME’s OFAC Reporter, Fircosoft
6.        Strong coordination and organisational skills. 
7.        Multi-tasking capabilities.
CHARACTER REQUIRED BY CANDIDATES
8.        Conscientious, easy to communicate with other people
9.        Highly motivated and self-directed

details: Job Description  If you are an experienced IT Business Analyst II looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help! We are a leading staffing firm and our clients include some over the nation’s biggest companies. Our client has a need for an IT Business Analyst II. This is a contract position; however it is not uncommon for assignments to transition into permanent positions with our client companies. If you have the background we are looking for, and you are interested in an opportunity to get your foot in the door with leading company, we want to talk with you!     IT Business Analyst II         Job Responsibilities Your specific duties as an IT Business Analyst II will include:  As a Product Owner you will be responsible for capturing business requirements from stakeholders and converting them to IT deliverables, system enhancements, and new features. Be an active member of an Agile software development team. Be accountable for communicating the product needs with business partners and development staff and work directly with development teams to clarify requirements and approve completed work. Collaborate with stakeholders during concept development/validation of a product(s) and solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, business partners and stakeholder management for a product(s). Develop and manage product backlog of MMFs, Features, Defects, and User Stories. Monitor project status and provide demos to stakeholders and prioritize project backlog based on ever changing customer/business feedback. Able to work off shift hours, for example early morning and/or late night    IT Business Analyst II Job Requirements As an IT Business Analyst II you must represent our company well by being responsible, punctual and motivated to go above and beyond the call of duty. You must also be highly detail-oriented and organized with excellent analytic and problem-solving abilities. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.  Bachelors of Arts/Science in Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent experience in a related career field. 4+ years project management experience. 4+ years’ experience gathering requirements for large scale applications. 3+ years of software delivery. 3+ years of Agile software development process experience. 1+ years of experience working on agriculture related software applications. Experience with direct interaction with customers and User Experience professionals in order to develop concepts into full solutions and demonstrate a fundamental understanding of end-to-end customer experience. Experience in roles that required demonstration of negotiation, interpersonal communications, and conflict resolution skills. Demonstrated ability to work on several projects/programs simultaneously. Experience in roles that required demonstration of excellent analytical and problem solving ability. Experience working with off-shore development teams. Experience with Ag Software related processes Experience working with external customers. Experience with enterprise/global applications. Experience and demonstrated high level understanding of Amazon Web Services platform technologies.      IT Business Analyst II  As an IT Business Analyst II with Bartech, you will be working through an established and respected staffing organization with 40 years of serving as a trusted partner to our client companies. We are dedicated to providing our talent with personal, responsive attention, and will assign an employee care representative to answer any questions or concerns that you might have. Depending upon the client, the assignment and your performance, you can find potential opportunities for direct employment. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with competitive compensation, including benefits. Available benefits for IT Business Analyst II Position may include (but are not limited to):  Exceptional medical, dental, and vision 401(k) Paid time off, including holidays                                                     Make the most of your experience! Apply now!  Applicant must be eligible to work in the US for immediate opening. Keywords:  business analyst, agile, amazon web services

TECHNICAL WMS BUSINESS ANALYST   Are you a super talented Business Analyst, looking for your next technical role? Are you looking to jump into a brand new project where your expertise is valued? This is your chance! The Select Group's client is looking for an excited WMS Business Analyst to join their team. Apply ASAP for immediate consideration!  About our client:  One of the area's top logistic company (with clients nationally and globally). The team that you will be working on is implementing an in-house Warehouse Management System (WMS). Be prepared to be a part of something big!  TECHNICAL BUSINESS ANALYST REQUIREMENTS: 

Mid- Senior level experience as a Technical Business Analyst


Must have hands on technical experience with WMS systems development, implementation, testing, and support




Experience with creating and utilizing SQL Queries and Stored Procedures



Direct experience within Warehouses and implementing go-live support



4 year degree, and must be willing to travel to sites (15-25%)


TECHNICAL BUSINESS ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES: 


Write specifications for new development and system enhancements



Support of WMS go- lives



Perform user acceptance testing and configuration of systems



Perform project and change management, as well as maintain ongoing client relationships 


About The Select Group:We are TSG - a fast-growing technical services firm serving the U.S. and Canada. We open doors to diversified prospective employers who respect and value your ambitions, your pursuit of a meaningful career, and your particular skill-set. We offer interview guidance, an impressive referral program, and partner with you to find work that drives you. Learn more about us in our company overview video, or visit us at http://www.selectgroup.com. Sign up to receive weekly job alerts in your inbox by joining the TSG Talent Network.We have the privilege of impacting lives, so let us impact yours.The Select Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

details: SkillStorm is seeking an IT Business Analyst for one of our clients in Charlotte, NC.  Job Description:  Demonstrate the flexibility needed to adjust to changes in the work environment as well as being a contributing team member. Analyze client software license purchase and software discovery data and perform reconciliation and remediation tasks to ensure data accuracy and quality. Conduct software license research to support clients purchasing and contracting requirements.  Organizes, analyzes, and manages purchase information to establish an accurate and complete summary of license entitlements.  Reconciles entitlements (based upon Product Use Rights, rules, allowances, etc. they embody) with software inventory information and guides the normalization, management and summarization of customer purchase information to assure complete and accurate analysis of the information.  Assist the process of defining the entitlement and inventory scope to assure entitlement and inventory information are properly aligned and consistent.  Understand Product Use Rights, license allowances, and contractual entitlements for software products and manufacturers (with a specialty in one or more manufacturers)  Analyze purchase records and other entitlement information (including contracts, EULAs, EAs, etc.)  Research Product and SKUs    Job Requirements:   Ability to analyze, interpret, and match data from multiple sources  Ability to identify and solve problems  Ability to work well in a team environment  Strong interpersonal communication skills  Ability to multitask and manage priorities with strong attention to details  Ability to perform duties independently with general supervision  Proficient with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access are essential

title: Business Analyst

details:
Our client, a leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 140 countries. They provide consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.Senior Business Analyst -A Senior Business Analyst with system implementation and process re-engineering experiences in the areas of financial control and/or balance sheet reporting to perform business analysis activities in support of critical planning and execution of project deliverables.Business description (group overview):The Finance Projects Group delivers automation and process re-engineering projects. These projects allow the firm to report P&L and balance sheet consistently across the globe, mitigate and better manage risks, improve financial controls, automate regulatory and management reporting, and perform transactional processing and ledger posting. In addition, these projects impact significant firm business and architecture initiatives such as security referential and pricing referential realignment, and revamp of the settlement and clearing platforms.Job Purpose:An senior analyst with experience in project management, product control and financial reporting functions. The candidate should possess system implementation and project management experience. The analyst will initially be responsible for capturing and documenting business processes, workflows, data flows, general business requirements. Activities may include communication and planning, process modeling, data analysis, business and functional requirements documentation, test specification, planning, coordination and execution.Key Responsibilities/ Day to Day Activities:- Work with senior managers, SMEs, and users to identify requirements and be responsible for Business Requirement Documents (BRD's), using use cases, workflow, screen mock-ups, and spreadsheet models.- Analyze current business and system processes for potential areas of improvement.- Perform data analysis on securities and transactions to identify the root cause and the resolution of the issues.- Coordinate with business and technology partners to get feedback and sign off's.- Complete or facilitate functional requirements process with technology partners.- Write or contribute to test scenarios and drive UAT planning and implementation.- Provide analysis and interpretation of UAT results.- Reconcile trades and positions from different sources.- Develop or contribute to cost analysis, design considerations, and implementation timelines.

Experience (years, type, nature of work, specialized knowledge and technical skills):- 4 to 7 years' experience in business analysis, financial reporting, system integration, business transformation, project management preferred.- Some knowledge of Fixed Income, Equities, Derivatives Instruments; and some knowledge in accounting and financial calculations, such as P&L, dividends, coupons, accretion.- Financial control and/or product control experience is a plus.- Be able to manage project milestones and risks.- Understand general ledger posting.- Experience in business process reengineering and software development life cycle is a plus- Experience in system analysis and writing business and functional specifications is a plus.- Strong data analysis, data mapping and reconciliation skills.Qualifications (educational background, licenses, professional knowledge) & Skills (soft skills):.- Good communications including the ability to compile and contribute to management level presentations.- Strong interpersonal, problem solving skills- Understand the tradeoffs and the limitations of technology.- Agent of change.- Be able to identify opportunities to solve business problems.- Bachelor's Degree; advanced professional qualifications are considered a plus.116774Please see our complete list of jobs at:www.rmscorp.com

details:
Business Analyst




Description: This Business Analyst, IT Systems and Compliance role will take direction from a Team Leader to support and enhance the quality and compliance operations posture for an IT department. Perform business analysis, compliance and computer system validation working between two company locations.

Responsibilities:

Performing, reviewing and/or approving quality and compliance work activities and documentation related to IT change management, computer system validation, periodic activities and software development.
Assist in integrating the IT department with both site manufacturing quality and global IT quality processes procedures as well as assist in continuous improvement projects for IT quality and compliance operations.
Manage projects and compliance activities as assigned.
Perform BT Quality Management activities related to qualification, GXP validation, and change-management of IT systems.
Provide technical expertise to write computer system lifecycle, validation, and decommissioning documentation in accordance with cGxP, 21 CFR Part 11, 210, and 211, and other applicable regulations and procedures.
Develop and manage project documentation for SDLC requirements during computer system implementation projects including developing user and functional requirements; technical and functional business process flows, use case, test case and test script documents; perform functionality, usability and testing during required project phases.
Perform IT system periodic activities and oversee the process for completion according to quality procedures.
Assist in performing impact assessments and work with technical SMEs to close-out IT related CAPAs and commitment tracking items.
Represent company BT in site level change control meetings and act as main point of contact for company BT core solution teams regarding change management, quality assurance and compliance management.
Work with Site Quality Organization and company BT Quality Assurance personnel staff to review, update and approve all documentation.
Act in a project lead and/or business analyst capacity for assigned projects to include performing project documentation, tracking and communicating project status and status of deliverables, risk and issue analysis and problem resolution.



Business Analyst






Business Analyst


W2 ONLY!! NO CORP TO CORP!!



Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or other science-related discipline.
BA with CSV (computer systems validation) experience.
At least 1 year of experience (ideally 3+ years) in current Good Manufacturing or Laboratory Practices, CFR 21 Part 11 regulations, Good Documentation Practices, and other applicable regulations for validated computerized systems.
At least 1 year of experience (ideally 3+ years) in writing Validation Documents (e.g. Validation Master Plans, Validation Protocols, Associated SOPs, Part 11 Risk Assessments, Verification Plans, Test Scripts).
Must have demonstrated capability in completing projects according to prescribed timelines and other requirements in previous project management or business analyst roles.
Excellent self-management, time management, and problem solving skills; must be able to multi-task / multi-project.
Be able to function in multidisciplinary teams, must possess excellent documentation, presentation, training and computer skills.


Experience w/ Aseptic Techniques, Manufacturing, GMP and FDA.


Experience with SDLC and other IT project management methodologies; Agile development is a plus.
Lean Six Sigma certification and/or experience preferred.
Familiarity with lab systems, plant manufacturing systems, Document Management Systems, CAPA processes, Learning Management Systems, highly desirable.

details: Our client, top Fortune 500 company, is experiencing incredible growth and with that it is a very exciting time to join as there are many opportunities for advancement. Their IT team is focused on identifying and developing key opportunities to drive efficiencies and enable their growth ambitions.   They are looking for a Ecommerce Business Analyst to work with the websites and the Business and Technical teams. The Ecommerce Business Analyst's primary focus is to partner with Business clients and actively work with the Ecommerce team to help translate business requirements for the Development team responsible for designing and coding a solution. This includes supporting the users of our client’s websites and the interfaces within the Ecommerce environment. The Ecommerce Business Analyst is a hands-on position in which the Ecommerce Business Analyst will be involved in requirements gathering, managing deliverables to timelines and milestones, coordination, troubleshooting, testing and training. The Ecommerce Business Analyst must understand and have experience working with Ecommerce, web platforms and packages. The Ecommerce Business Analyst must also possess knowledge of technologies and digital marketing as well as have Agile experience. Key Job Responsibilities:  Drive out and document user experience, system and business process requirements for ecommerce features and a subsequent fulfillment operation. Work in both traditional project methodologies and agile methodology, including the ability to write user stories. Partner with business and technical principals and properly define the minimum viable product features as well as future enhancements. Experience in ecommerce and custom product development preferred. International experience preferred.  Analyze and document existing processes and operating procedures Analyze business issues and objectives and work with Business and Technology to craft a solution Participate in/facilitate small to large projects including project planning input and schedule updates Develop and/or review project methodology documentation including: business requirements, user stories, functional specifications, project benefits and costs, deployment strategies, training plans and materials, test plans, other technical and business materials Coordinate user acceptance testing with the business Develop templates and/or department standards Conduct testing Conduct training Conduct informal and formal presentations, including meeting facilitation Provide production support when necessary  Qualifications:  Experience in agile methodologies Experience writing agile user stories Experience working with ecommerce platforms like Websphere, Demandware, Hybris, etc. Experience working with content management platforms like Adobe, Drupal, Sitecore, etc. Experience working with functional ecommerce areas like checkout, product detail pages, my account, shipping, returns, customer service etc. Experience working in an Agile Environment Senior BA Experience (5 plus years) 2-3+ years of experience in design, problem solving, and implementation of Ecommerce technology and applications. This includes a solid understanding of Ecommerce and Marketing functions. MS Office tools - Excel, Powerpoint, Visio, MS Project and MS Word Experience with a Software Development Life Cycle methodology including Agile functions for Business Analysis (e.g. User Stories). Systems support or development experience a plus Bachelor's Degree, MIS, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration  About JDC Group JDC Group is a technology recruiting and staffing company based in Atlanta, Georgia. Founded in 2005, we connect exceptional technology talent with successful companies all over North America to form productive teams. We were voted one of Atlanta’s Best and Brightest Companies to Work For® and named one of Inc. 5000’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies in America. To learn more about us, please visit www.jdc-group.com.

details:
Senior Business Analyst Summary:Signature Consultants is seeking a Senior Business Analyst for an opportunity in Miami, FL. The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for guiding the development team by formulating and formalizing business requirements to build digital products and enhancements. The role serves as the glue between the Product Owner and the development team. He or she will work with the Product Owner using functional knowledge and engaging with technical peers to help define strategic direction. The Senior BA needs to be a master of Agile requirements gathering which includes writing stories, breaking stories down, ordering stories, and writing acceptance criteria, as this role is a critical to group facilitation. This position employs business process knowledge, analysis, design, testing and collaboration with internal and external business partners including vendors and technical peers to accomplish assignments.Responsibilities:
Understand current business practices and work collaboratively with internal and external business partners including vendors to identify opportunities for business changes
Assist with the prioritization of business needs and ensure technology solutions provided are aligned with business goals to achieve and exceed customer expectations
Lead initiation, planning and management of product suite portfolio to meet customer needs and business strategy
Collaborate with internal and external constituents, including vendors, to meet common goals and resolve conflicting issues
Lead, direct, and provide functional guidance to team.
Define interdependency with other disciplines and is involved in the testing and certification processes
Plan, design, and support the implementation of complex functional and technical applications and systems
Facilitate analysis and formulating of processes or systems to parallel overall business strategy
Own management of Agile process management tool
Support the maintenance of computer systems and software applications
Interpret, refine and apply methods and procedures in accordance with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Information Technology industry standards, Agile methods, and best practices as defined by the client
Remain current with industry trends in order to conceive, prototype and recommend functional approaches for IT systems and solutions that meet business needs
Meet expectations in meeting deadline within budget, schedule and appropriate quality
Accountable for financial implications and cost of systems and services
Responsible for defining optimization opportunities to manage expenses
Perform other duties as required
Qualifications:
Solid understanding of accounting rules for expense and capital activities
Solid understanding of client IT and Agile estimation activities. May lead large/complex estimation activities
May require a bachelor's degree in area of specialty
5+ years of experience in the field or in a related area
Expert in Agile Modeling methods
Demonstrates strong knowledge and capabilities within specific area of responsibility
Demonstrates strong knowledge of Agile and Portfolio Management methods
Ability to coach, mentor, train others
Good verbal and written communication skills
Subject matter expertise in analysis and requirements gathering process, testing, tools, and best practices
Demonstrate a certain degree of creativity with strong analytical, and problem solving skills
Ability to contribute to the formulation, communication and implementation of technical solutions
Proven ability to collaborate across internal and external organization including vendors
Capable of working independently with minimal supervision. May lead or direct the work of others
Strong with methodologies, tools, best practices and processes within specific area of responsibility
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent group facilitation skills
Subject matter expertise in Agile Visual Modeling methods
About Signature Consultants, LLCHeadquartered in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Signature Consultants was established in 1997 with a singular focus: to provide clients and consultants with superior staffing solutions. For the seventh consecutive year, Signature was voted as one of the "Best Staffing Firms to Work For" and is now the 14th largest IT staffing firm in the United States (source: Staffing Industry Analysts). With 26 locations throughout North America, Signature annually deploys thousands of consultants to support, run, and manage their clients' technology needs. Signature offers IT staffing, consulting, managed solutions, and direct placement services. For more information on the company, please visit www.sigconsult.com.

details:
TISTA is looking for a Business Analyst to work with the Program Manager to support our client’s objective to implement an Enterprise-wide Privacy Program.  The candidate will successfully work with a team to further the client’s Privacy Maturity Model efforts through strategic planning and privacy program implementation activities.  The candidate should have excellent research, writing and organization skills.  The preferred candidate will have knowledge of federal policies and procedures related to handling personally identifiable information (PII), protected health information (PHI) and sensitive but unclassified information (SBU).  Prior consulting experience and experience with business process re-engineering, process improvement, and organizational change is a plus.



Analyze Privacy Program requirements and risk, as well as identify gaps in compliance processes


Coordinate with stakeholders at the highest levels to document program requirements


Capture data, collect relevant documentation and participate in reporting requirements


Provide solutions to accomplish overall operational efficiency, organizational change and cultural change of Privacy Program office


Demonstrate a strong understanding of safeguarding personally identifiable information (PII) and protected health information (PHI)


Demonstrate knowledge of Maturity Models, process redesign, performance measurement and management, strategy, risk management


Support weekly, bi-weekly and quarterly reporting requirements



Provide research on privacy practices and federal privacy environments


Responsible for quality reviews


Demonstrate exceptional written, oral and analytical skills



Qualifications:


Prior experience as a consultant supporting a federal client


Ability to perform research, analysis, and risk management in a team environment


Knowledge of business process analysis and improvement


Ability to work under pressure, with time constraints and minimal oversight


Knowledge of government privacy processes and policies


Must have experience using MS Office Suite, including MS Project, MS Visio


Must have experience using SharePoint


Preferred Qualifications:


Knowledge of federal IT systems and the SA&A process preferred


Knowledge of privacy statutory authority and guidance (e.g., Privacy Act of 1974, E-Government Act of 2002, OMB Circular A-130, NIST publications and FISMA) preferred


Knowledge of data management, protecting personal information and matter related to general information disclosure preferred


Education:


Bachelor’s Degree or higher


10 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education


Clearance Requirements:

Required obtain a NACI level clearance

 
Location:

NW Washington, DC 


TISTA is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

details:
Mid to Senior IT Business Analyst 
Exciting opportunity for a Mid to Senior IT Business Analyst to join a first class organization! 

We are looking for a Business Analyst who has experience gathering requirements and is able to communicate requirements to the development team. Ideal candidates will have a CIS degree and great collaboration skills. Applicants with a background in Supply Chain, ERP systems or manufacturing will be a great match!

details: IT Business AnalystPosition SummaryThis (BA) position will be a part of a team of BA's working on a program to modernize core legacy applications.In this role, the BA will work closely with IT and business stakeholders to understand and document how the business utilizes legacy applications in day-to-day processes, as well as, identify pain points and opportunities for improvement. The BA will act as a liaison between stakeholders and development team to represent interests of the stakeholders, clarify requirements, and solve for identified gapsAn ideal candidate will think holistically across people, process, and technology with emphasis on people and process, as well as demonstrate strong analytical thinking, communication, leadership and influencing skills. Job Duties1. Plan and facilitate requirements sessions to identify and validate requirements with ITand business stakeholders.2. Deliver appropriate artifacts for assigned projects based on program guidelines including process models, use cases, user stories, context diagrams, business rules, decisionmodels, reporting requirements, and others as needed.3. Collaborate with BA team members to identify gaps and dependencies in requirements across applications and departments.4. Review artifacts and requirements with stakeholders to obtain approvals.5. Manage and communicate requirements throughout the software development lifecycle, including requirements prioritization, requirements changes, and conflict resolution.6. Support the QA organization during User Acceptance Testing to ensure solutions meet the business requirements and help determine the most appropriate actions to address problems identified through project testing or other assessment efforts. Required Qualifications* 7+ years IT/IS business analysis experience.* Ability to define current/future business models and influence the interconnectionsbetween the business processes, technology, data and people.* Ability to simplify and communicate complex concepts to broad audiences.* Ability to manage multiple sets of priorities and deliverables in a fast-pace environment.* Ability to create Use Cases, User Stories and Business Process Models.* Experience working in Agile, Waterfall, and Hybrid methodologies.* Strong facilitation, active listening and interpersonal skills.* Ability to develop and foster strong relationships with business and IT teams.* Fluent in English speaking and writing skills.* Ability to deal with complex situations holistically.* Intuitively assess the best course of action to take in a given situation and understandhow and when to apply guidelines.* Experience working on large and complex projects throughout the SDLC.* Experience working on technology projects with vendors.* Experience working with distributed teams.* Experience managing and working through organizational change.* Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Visio. Preferred Experience:* Railroad industry experience.* Six Sigma Certification.* CBAP (Certified Business Analyst Professional).* Experience working on legacy modernization projects.* Experience effectively identifying requirements for web-based, COTS, and ERP applications.* Experience utilizing a business rules management system (BRMS).* Bi-lingual Spanish/English both written and spoken.Interested candidates please send resume in Word format to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] Please reference job code 50708 when responding to this ad.GDH Consulting, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran's status or any other category protected by law. details:

The Senior Business Analyst works with stakeholders to detail enhancements within time constraints. Further, the Senior Business Analyst provides documentation and testing on projects with minimal or no supervision.Duties and Responsibilities
Elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for business processes from users.

Production support to troubleshoot issues and answer user questions in a timely manner.

Develop reports (Excel, SQL) that expedite requirement analysis or testing of large and complex projects.
Lead the UAT cycle, formulate testing strategies and assist users and developers in testing of key deliverables.
Mentor junior team members by suggesting in best practices and peer reviewing documentation.

Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong analytical skills
In depth understanding of fixed income securities and rate products.
Experience as a Business Analyst leveraging formal Business Analysis methods (particularly Use Cases) to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements.
General technical background required (understanding of principals and key practices in the areas of application programming, database and system design).
Working knowledge of SQL
Working knowledge of Excel
Preferred:
A degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Operations Research is a plus.
Advanced degree is a plus.

title: Business Analyst

details:
Job Tittle: Business Analyst
Location: Frankfort, KY
Duration: Long-term Indefinite 
Interview type: Interviews: in person 
 

Client has an immediate need for an exceptional individual to join our organization as a Business Analyst. This opportunity is based in Frankfort, KY. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, critical thinking skills, possesses leadership skills, and is committed to delivering successful and quality work products that completely address Business Unit requirements. The candidate must have the ability to envision impacts and possibilities of their work on the broader Client organization and apply those thoughts to improve their analysis efforts.

 
Core Responsibilities
The IT Business Analyst (BA) will assist the Project Manager (PM) in the management of the project work by facilitating communication with the business unit/customer, project team, and other stakeholders as necessary related to requirements and proposed solution for the project. The BA will elicit business requirements (features & user stories) for assigned project requests, and manage the product backlog. For each upcoming sprint, the BA will decompose the user stories to a consumable level that is understood by the developers. The BA will lead the team in the identification of acceptance criteria for the decomposed user stories. The BA will ask business stakeholders probing questions and communicate that information to the development team to ensure they understand the requested work. The BA is expected to understand the business processes and to use that knowledge to make recommendations for business process improvements as well as improve the value to the end user and the Transportation Cabinet.




 
 

   
 
Minimum Requirements 

Bachelor’s Degree with a focus in IT or equivalent combination of experience/knowledge
2-3 Years’ experience working with businesses to identify and document IT needs and facilitate solutions
Experience and comfort with business analysis, requirements definition & vetting
Knowledge of and experience with agile process
Strong analytical, design and problem solving skills
Ability to work independently/self-reliant and show initiative with minimum supervision
Ability to quickly learn new technology and apply appropriately to business situations
Strong team player who enjoys working in a fast paced team atmosphere
Ability to work under pressure; meet strict deadlines
Ability to listen effectively and seek clarification
Ability to build a rapport with clients

Excellent written and oral communication skills in English. Must be able to effectively and comfortably communicate with all types of individuals from the customer technical expert to the customer executive management


 
Best Regards,

details:
Job ID: 4355Position Description: Joseph T. Ryerson & Son, Inc., one of the largest metals distributors in the US, is currently seeking a Business Analyst to join our Analytics team in Lisle, IL. The successful candidate will play a vital role in driving the financial performance of Ryerson by contributing to the development of analytic tools used to optimize our business and supply chain operations. The Analytics team is part of the office of the Chief Data Officer and supports key decision makers throughout all functional areas and management levels of Ryerson. Our toolset includes best in breed software such as IBM Cognos, Oracle, SAP and Salesforce.com as well as the ability to leverage in-house programming resources for custom application development. Roles and Responsibilities: • Understand the content, structure and business meaning of data from various systems such as the Data Warehouse, ERP Platforms, web site or external sources. Help enable ongoing expansion of same. • Collaborate on development of analytic tools with business experts, programmers, developers and other analysts. These tools include reports, dashboards, models and ad-hoc queries used by decision makers to gain required insight into complex business circumstances utilizing software such as Cognos, Salesforce.com, SPSS, SAP, Google Analytics or Excel. • Work with data from a variety of business disciplines ranging from the local service center operations to corporate departments such as Sales, Supply Chain, Operations, Human Resources, Accounting, and Treasury. • Gather and document requirements for datasets and reports as well as business user training materials. • Aid in the data collection, testing and validation for newly created and existing data sources. • Provide tactical analytical support to meet business demands as required.Position Requirements: Skills and Abilities: • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative major such as Supply Chain, Business Analytics, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or similar business area. • Strong quantitative and logical thinking skills, combined with the ability to think creatively in order to envision relationships between data, and communicate those findings to key decision makers. • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and understand new software products and concepts, including ability to self-instruct using available texts and other resources. • Excellent organizational skills with emphasis on attention to detail, ability to organize tasks, manage multiple projects, create and maintain documentation, prioritize work and meet deadlines with minimal direct supervision. • Advanced level abilities in Microsoft Excel and Access, including knowledge of pivot tables, vlookups, and query writing to collect, transform and evaluate data to provide actionable information. • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to interact across multiple departments and levels within a medium to large size enterprise. • Experience working with business analytic software such as IBM Cognos BI / TM1 and CRM software such as Salesforce.com is a strong plus. • 1 – 5 years of experience We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

details:
BSI currently has an opening for Senior Business Analyst in our Technology Park, Norcross, GA headquarters.
 
 
BSI:  Where experience meets innovation in the payroll tax compliance industry. BSI is a privately held entity that has been in the tax compliance business since 1979.  Our payroll tax software pioneered the modern tax system and currently over 20 million employees are processed through our solutions. Our solid knowledgebase, utilization of the latest technology and strong dedication to service and support have allowed us to build our business, evolve our products and stay in the forefront of the industry.
 
 
BSI has excellent benefits and compensation.  Our comprehensive benefits package includes company-paid medical, dental, STD, LTD, Life Insurance and AD&D.  Generous PTO and company holidays, 401(k) and profit sharing are also available.  Flexible start and telecommute program available for many positions.
